"Why should I?" asked Simba, talking with a mouth half full of food, purposely letting the meat bits fly at his hyena slaves. "I'm the king and I rule all."

"Very good, my liege," Scar said bowing, knowing his plan was another step closer.
141112111.title: The King's Rage

1411121112.content:
To say Simba was frightful that first day was an understatement as time passed. The once carefree innocent child had become malevolent under his uncle's teachings. His gleamed with a constant ferocity that the hyenas had chosen to avoid. It was similar to what made them fear and obey Scar, despite him being a lion. Simba was also well verse at the deceptive arts, seeing full well what his uncle was doing to him. Already he gut had drooped down to his knees and his legs had widened. His neck was reduced thanks to a second chin and if he wasn't so scary the hyenas would have laughed at his bubble butt.

Simba knew that Scar was attempting to fatten him up for some devious plan to become the next king. He found out several days ago; he only faked ignorance since he figured Scar would just use the hyenas to force feed him or even get rid of him. Until he could come up with a plan to overpower Scar he had to play along. At the same time he found a strange delight in glutting himself to the point of bloating. His parents always told him eating too much was bad, but he felt it as a power trip on his deep desire to become king.

One day Scar approached Simba as he finished the rest of the meat he had been given at the beginning. "So, tell me, how do you feel?"

"I never felt like this before," Simba said in a dark tone. It was angrier and more savage than his voice used to be. At first he could only do it when he built up enough anger, but it seemed almost like he was stuck with it now. "I like it the enormity of it all. This power is wonderful. It rushes through my veins."

Scar chuckled seeing he picked up on his own vocabulary quite fast. "So, tell me? Is it enough?"

"NO!" Simba roared almost crazily. "I need more. More... more... I need more...
1411121112.title: Simba The Savage

choices: ...I Will Let You Keep This Place And The Hyenas After I Obtain The Pridelands"
...You Should Be The One To Rule The Pridelands"
14111211121.content:
The word "food" echoes through the halls. The hyenas heard him and crawled in on their front paws. They fearfully approached their king.

"I require food," he said, standing before them, his gut hanging down nearly touching the ground. For a cub he was overweight, but it didn't make him look any less intimidating. If anything it proved just how ravenous he had become. "Go out and bring me all the food you can find. Now be off before I take a bite out of you."

The hyenas crept away whimpering like little kittens. Simba let out another angry roar that started them into running away. He chuckled enjoying at the pathetic creatures. He had always been afraid of them, but after finding this power within himself he saw how spineless they were.

"You have grown quite very good at commanding your servants," said Scar caressing Simba's stomach. "You are not the weak little runt you were not so long ago."

"And I have you to thank," replied Simba. "But it is clear that you've just used this as a means to your own desires. You want the Pridelands."

Scar chuckled. "I guess I trained you too well," admitted Scar. "Perhaps I should get rid of you before you become a threat, but I must say I have genuinely enjoyed this quality time we've have unlike when I was just acting."

"So, even Scar has a heart," commented Simba. "I see no reason why you shouldn't have the Pridelands. After all, I have grown content with my life here. If I help you obtain the Pridelands I assume you would have no trouble allowing me to keep this land for my own?"

"And what guarantee do I have that you won't try and attack me when all that is done?" asked Scar.

"The same you can give me," answered Simba. The two lions circled one another looking each other over, but before long they both collapsed to the ground laughing. The two of them were vile, deceitful, cruel, tyrants now, but because of that they were closer than they had ever been and despite all that they seemed to find a kindred spirit in one another.

Before long, the hyenas returned with all the food they could carry, including three hippos. As they had grown accustomed to, they got in line to feed their king, feeding it right into his muzzle. It was stomach churning for them to see such a small animal eat so much food, but fascinating at the same time. Simba ate larger and larger amounts of food to the point he could even made a credible dent in a hippo in one sitting and Simba would normally have five or six meals a day whenever he desired it, even if it was well into the night when the hyenas were asleep.

As the Simba had the last bit of meat slide down his throat he dismissed the hyenas with a wave of his paw. He had eaten nearly half of a hippo before getting full and was determined to finish it when he got hungry later. Scar, who had been watching the entire time came up to Simba again. "I've been thinking, my liege," he said bowing "as much as I hate to admit I care about you. So in response to our discussion earlier I think that..."
14111211121.title: Feeding The Beast

choices: They Talk About Their Plans During The Feast
141112111212.content:
Simba's ears perked up upon hearing those words. It was not what he said, but how he said it. There was no hint of some trickery or ulterior motive. And the look in his eyes wasn't normal. it was like that of a father looking proudly at his son.

"Simba, I've never known what it was like to raise a son and to leave a legacy other than one etched in stone. This whole scheme was supposed to be one that made me king, but in the time we've bonded, I see you as if you were my own," Scar told Simba.

Simba didn't give it much thought before, but this newfound respect and admiration for Scar had left a mark on his heart. Simba may not have been his by blood, but in this time, he had been remade in his image. This should have been time he spent with his father figure to help him develop into adulthood, but when he thought of his father, all he could think of was Scar and among the wickedness, treachery, and anger, there was love.

"I feel the same way," said Simba in a rare instant that his voice sounded remotely like it once did.

Scar nuzzled up against his fat side and gently stroked his stomach, not threatening to scratch him with his claws. "Then from now on... my son... I will make you king. I will continue to make you a glutton and give you all the power in the Pridelands. From this day forward, it will be my only aspiration," Scar said in a calm tone.

Simba and Scar gave each other a smirk of the things to come that was soon interrupted by a rumble in Simba's stomach.

"It seems it is time to feed the beast," joked Scar, poking Simba in the gut.

"Food!" roared Scar and Simba in sync, forcing nearly every hyena to rush in and start stuffing the hippo meat down Simba's gullet. Simba ate more ravenously than ever, finding his hunger more intense than ever and now having a strong desire to meet Scar's expectations of becoming a colossal king that he could be proud of.

The hyenas were soon halted by the tall dark lion. "I will take over feeding Simba," he ordered. "Just bring me the food. It is only right, after all, since he is my most valuable treasure," Scar said with a smirk.

Simba smiled and continued to eat and consume the remains of the hippo.
141112111212.title: A Father's Love

choices: Simba Amazingly Eats The Hippo And Everything Else
Simba Stops At The Hippo To Begin Planning Their Conquest Of The Pridelands
1411121112122.content:
Scar sat Simba on his lap as the meat was brought over to him. He had seen Simba gain, but this was the first time he actually felt the difference in his weight. He figured before long, Simba would be too big and fat for him; all the more reason to do what he could while he still had time. He started out feeding Simba lovingly one piece at a time then rubbed his stomach as he chewed to help his digestion. This only continued for a short while since he was certain Simba was more interested in bonding in the way their relationship was formed; with trickery and ulterior motives.

Scar stopped feeding Simba and let the meat stack up. Simba was displeased by this for a moment, but as soon as he realized what Scar was planning, he just waited, not wanting to go against his parent's wishes. When he had a decent stack, he took one and placed it into Simba's mouth. Simba chewed it innocently and just as he expected, another piece of meat was crammed into his mouth. Simba couldn't spit it out as Scar kept a hand over his mouth and reached for a third piece. Simba tried to keep up, but he couldn't keep up as more and more meat was forced in. With little choice, Simba had to swallow down huge chunks of meat, causing a huge bulge to slide down his throat. It was a tiring experience, but he didn't have time to rest as Scar prepared for the next round.

"How was that?" Asked Scar.

Simba considered how he should respond to Scar and one idea came to mind. "It hurts," He said with tears forming in his eyes. He sounded like he did when he first arrived; small and weak.

Scar knew what he was doing and played along. "It's alright, my little cub," He said while using all his strength to cradle the obese lion. "You just need to keep working at it and you'll become a true glutton at last. You'll be able to swallow huge chunks of food with ease," Scar said.

Simba nodded as he opened his mouth and waited for the stuffing to resume. Scar continued his pace again, though Simba was showing signs of improvement as he downed food in only a few bites. His early signs of discomfort from eating such large amounts of food at once vanished as he grew accustomed to it. Before long, Simba was eating piece for piece with Scar. The only reason they had to stop was because they finished all the meat that was within reach.

"Did I do good?" Asked Simba with eyes full of eagerness to please.

"You did wonderful," Scar said, rubbing their noses together. "But don't do this for me. Do this for yourself. Have pride in your talents and more so in your greed and gluttony. Let it define you!"

Simba took those words to heart and his innocent bright eyed look shifted to an evil smirk.

Scar placed Simba on the ground and ordered the hyenas to bring a fat, zebra carcass a few feet away from Simba.

"You must show dominance as a leader. That means you go first and get what you desire. Don't stop until you are satisfied. If they get nothing from the hunt, so be it. Now go!"

Simba attacked the food, tearing through it like he hadn't just been stuffed a few seconds ago. Large chunks were torn off and vanished into his mouth. In mere moments, the zebra was just bones.

"He's like a piranha," cried one of the hyenas while backing away.
"There'd be nothing for us to eat if he wanted," whimpered another.
"He's a monster!" finished the third.

"Silence!" shouted Scar. "That 'monster' is my son and I guess he does take after me. And you will address him as king from now on or if you so feel, monster king!"

Simba soon approached Scar again. Once more, he seemed to have changed his personality more towards his dark self that he currently was. Scar felt like he was looking into a mirror, albeit Simba was several hundred pounds overweight. As Simba approached Scar, he seemed to be walking on air, proudly like the king he was destined to be.

"You all can have the rest," he said, smugly referring to the skeleton.

The comment made Scar laugh. "Good, my son. You're truly becoming a great man," He rubbed Simba's stomach to help it digest. "When you are king, you can have as many females tend to your belly as you want. There'll be a lot more belly by then. Now one last thing," Scar told him motioning to the whole hippo remaining.

Simba looked at it and licked his chops before saying, "Always eat all the gifts your servants bring to you," he stated just as Scar had. His voice was once again different. It didn't have that forced darkness that he had when trying to imitate Scar. It was natural and it was his. It may have been coincidence or perhaps some mental stimulation from the bonding. It may have even been fate, but it was clear that Simba was finally an adult. He attacked the hippo and tore away at it.

Scar brushed a tear from his eye and thought, "They grow up so fast!"
1411121112122.title: Bonding

choices: ...How About A Little Meal While I Explain The Plan?"
...It Is Time To Return To The Pridelands!"
14111211121221.content:
To the old Simba, a hippo was a meal that would feed an entire lion den or keep him with food for a month. Now it was like a snack to him to barely satisfy his appetite. Scar watched from the sidelines as the meat dissapeared inside of Simba's ever growing belly. Before long, it was reduced to bones and Simba moved on to the scraps he somehow missed and finished them off too.

"So, how was it?" asked Scar as he was approaching a pleasantly stuffed Simba who was licking the flavor of animal meat off his paws.

Simba let out a belch that reached to the furthest points of the temple. "It was delicious," he replied. "I can't wait to see what they bring next time and I promise not to take so long," Simba said.

"I know you won't," replied Scar, giving his belly another rub. "Now we must begin planning!"

"Alright," agreed Simba before he yawned.

"Looks like you could use a nap," replied Scar in a loving parent tone.

"It's alright," replied Simba. "I'll be fine!"

Scar rubbed Simba's belly to force him to relax and yawn some more.

"No. All that eating has really done a number on you. Rest for now, my king, and when you awaken, we will have a plan prepared for your conquest of the Pridelands," Scar said with a grin.

Simba couldn't argue if he wanted to. The next thing he knew, he was out cold on the floor. Scar looked down on his sleeping king, thinking that he slept just like a little cub and just as innocent as the cub he used to be. He watched him a bit longer before leaving the room with the hyenas to piece together a plan.

----------------------------------

Simba awoke a few hours later feeling the bulge in his stomach had shrank and softened as well as spread throughout his body. He admired the new layers of fat as he walked around enjoying as his body jiggled. His belly rubbed against the floor. He was considering having a servant to keep it elevated, but he doubted walking would be an option for him, at least once he ruled the Pridelands and was seated on his throne.

"It's good to see you're awake," said Scar who was returning to the room.

"The same to you, father," Simba replied as he sat on his throne. "Have you come up with a plan?"

"Of course," he replied. "It is very easy when the enemy is so trusting of both of us. We can practically walk in and take over without much of a fight," Scar grinned.

"True," smirked Simba. "But I'd rather crush them outright. I'd hate to win without playing the game first," Simba said with a fat, evil grin.

"That's my boy," said Scar. "But what I want to talk to you about first is your kingly title. You'll need one so all the other animals will know and fear you at just the mere mention of it. After some discussion, I found one that fits you to a tee: King Simba, the Behemoth," Scar said with a grin.

Those words processed in his mind as he considered them. He had expected something more focused on his girth or his weight, but such names would have been silly. The hyena's laughter would have awoken him to be certain of that. This name, on the other hand, made him sound big and powerful and he couldn't disagree with that. It also reflected on the monster he truly had become.

"It's perfect," replied Simba. "It is a name that will be remembered for ages of the king to end all kings," Simba said.

"Indeed it will," said Scar. "Now then...
14111211121221.title: Simba The Behemoth Is Born

choices: Simba Returns With Everyone Happy To See Him
Simba Returns, But Nobody Likes What He's Become
141112111212212.content:
"We're returning home, Scar?" asked Simba surprised. He expected it would still be some time before they were ready to act.

"Yes. You see, after some thought, we realized that no matter what, you are the next in line. It is your birth right after all and you already have proven that you are a great king!"

"But won't anyone be against me?" asked Simba. "Surely, they won't be happy at my disappearance or my new appearance. They'll probably dislike my new view of being a king as well and consider it a result of you manipulating me!"

"True, all true," replied Scar. "Though that last one is something you developed under my tutelage. It could hardly be called manipulation!"

"Yeah, but deep down, the other adult lions never trusted you," said Simba, recalling how Scar was always prevented from ever truly belonging to the Pridelands and knew such a fate might befall him as well.

"That is why I've already set the hyenas out to gather their kin," explained Scar. "By the time we return, they'll be ready. If they accept you back, there won't be a need for it, but should they turn on you, we will have an all out war and turn their home that they selfishly keep for themselves into a war zone. Their choices are simple; they can either live under your rule as citizens... or slaves!"

"Is there really a difference?" asked Simba.

"There is indeed," replied Scar, who was grinning devilishly which made Simba smirk back. "So, let's hope they do this the hard way so you can see how the Pridelands should have been like all along!"

-----------------------------------------------------

Several days passed. It was hard for Scar to bring Simba to Pride Rock with his obese body and they had to travel at a much slower pace. Simba was just glad they did it before returning was completely impossible because the more he thought about his rule over the Pridelands, the more it continued to corrupt him with greed. He only had a handful of servants to care for him in the temple, but in the Pridelands, he'd have more than he could count. He had even made schemes of his own to enact when he ascended to the throne that would make Scar tear up from being so proud like plans to breed the other animals in the Pridelands to make them grow up larger and fatter to satisfy him ravishing appetite. He also thought of forcing them into a more sedate lifestyle to make their muscles weak and their bodies burn less calories. Thinking of having animals born with the sole purpose of feeding him made his mouth water. Once the Pridelands were his, they would be unlike anything anyone could imagine and Simba's greed was already making him think about the lands outside the Pridelands. More food, more power, and more of everything. He would expand his territory to the ends of the known world and further if he could and grow obese enough to cover every inch of it. It wasn't a matter if he could succeed. Simba knew it was only a matter of time.
141112111212212.title: The Prodigal Son Returns

choices: ...Left To Join Scar So They Could Begin The Battle
1411121112122122.content:
Simba expected to make quite an impression on his return. He certainly did, but not as he would have liked it. The first thing everyone did was stare and then they met him with unkind eyes. Some even growled at him, like they were looking at an intruder, but he was their king and their ruler. They should have bowed at his presence.

It was Nala who was the one to break the silence. "Simba, it's you," she cried rushing over to him. She had to take a moment to take in all his girth before talking to him. "I heard you returned, but I never believed it!"

"Well as you can see," replied Simba. "Your king has returned!"

"No," she told him sadly shaking her head. "You shouldn't have come here. Rumors spread that Scar took you to make into his puppet so he could rule the Pridelands. Once word spread, the king had to banish you from ever returning. It was such a painful thing for him, he secluded himself on the top of Pride Rock," Nala said to Simba.

"Whatever rumors you've heard, they aren't true," explained Simba. "I never became his puppet, but I did become his son. Now I'm here to rule the Pridelands as my father would have!"

"Simba, don't you hear yourself?" Nala weeped. "The Simba I knew never talked like this!"

"The Simba you knew was a spoiled, weak, little kid," roared Simba. "I've grown and matured. Now I'm ready to rule these lands and the world as I always should have. If you had been different, I might had chose you as my queen, but now I see you are no different than the rest," Simba said with a frown.

Heartbroken at the monster Simba had become, she watched as Simba...
1411121112122122.title: Cold Welcome

choices: "If That's What You Want, Then We Are Going To War!"
14111211121221221.content:
The journey to the top of Pride Rock was harder than normal thanks to his increased girth, but his desire for the throne made him ignore it. He knew once he was in charge such annoyances would be a thing of the past. There were plenty of other lions and lionesses who watched him, growled and hiss with disgust at him either because he was so obese or because he was allied with Scar. He didn't care. He just grinned and glared back scaring them to back off.

"They don't realize it yet," thought Simba darkly. "But they already fear me and regard me as their king!"

By the time Simba had reached the top the sun had set and a red moon illuminated the sky. He could still vaguely remember when he was still a cub and he was held up to the sun. This felt like a sign that he had abandoned his old life and was truly a dark lion now.

"Simba, explain yourself," his father told him. "What has happened to you?"

"Isn't it obvious?" asked Simba. "I've grown up, no thanks to you!"

"Don't you see what you've become?" cried his mother. "You've been just a pawn to sky. Please come back to us!"

"Can't the same be said about both of you?" asked Simba. "You raised me to think like you, to be cowardly and weak. At least with Scar's teachings I can act like a real king live I've always wanted!"

"That type of king will ruin this land," roared Mufasa. "It will be the end of everything!"

"And your way of rule only allows your power to be taken away with ease," laughed Simba. "Like it is right now. Either you can relinquish the throne to me now or fight for it, but I guarantee that you will lose badly!"

"Simba," begged his mother. "Come back to us. Come back to your family!"

"The only family I need is my father, Scar," replied Simba. At first it was difficult to tell if the lion they were talking to was really Simba, but after talking to him, they didn't know the evil lion before them.

"I can't do this," cried Simba's mother. She ran back down Pride Rock in tears. Simba didn't show a strand of regret.

"You made your mother cry," snarled Mufasa.

"So you do have a backbone," taunted Simba.

"This is not a game," roared Mufasa. "Do you want me to banish you?"

"See, that's why you aren't worthy of being king," said Simba. "You are too soft. I am a threat you cannot allow to exist and yet you want to show me mercy. All it will do is allow for more pain and suffering. Face it, your era is over," Simba taunted.

The lions and lionesses watching them were drawing near, enraged by Simba's actions. They were ready to attack on their King's words. Simba may have been Mufasa's son, but it was clear he was not the same lion he was so long ago. They expected their king to roar the order, but he only answered weakly.
14111211121221221.title: Old King Vs. New Tyrant

choices: Once Simba Finishes, He Has To Rally The Troops
Once Simba Finishes, He Goes To Sleep
14111211121221222.content:
Simba turned away from Pride Rock. He didn't need to proceed any further than he did to know everyone would be no different from the welcoming committee at the bottom. When Simba entered Scar's lair, it was as creepy and dark as he remembered it. It used to give him chills down his spine in fear, but he felt right at home, feeling totally relaxed in the dark. He imagined remaking Pride Rock to be more to his new taste as well. When he reached the main cavern of Scar's home, he was delighted to see Scar with a much larger group of hyenas than he had at the jungle temple and some food laid out for him.

"How did it go?" asked Scar.

"As well as you could expect," replied Simba. "They treated me like an outsider. I guess that's how you were treated all your life!"

"It was a harsh life," commented Scar. "One that we will make them all regret doing once they are all under your rule!"

"So, how are things going?" asked Simba.

"Quite well," explained Scar. "The hyenas are already rallying up for us in large numbers to come here. Once there are enough, we will begin the attack," Scar grinned.

"And what will my role be?" asked Simba.

"The role any king should take," explained Scar. "You will remain here where it's safe. You will live as a king and eat all you please!"

"Sounds good to me," replied Simba with a grin. "It will be like I've never left the temple!"

"I doubt that," stated Scar, grinning darkly as he walked around while Simba was looking him over. "This cave of mine is a place full of darkness. It was like that well before I was here and it transformed me into the man you see before you, mind you I was much older than you were. Some time spent in here might do your mind and body good that even I could have never taught you," Scar said.

Simba breathed in the air of the cave. He always felt this place was different than any other place on the Pride Lands and now he found himself embracing that darkness and infusing it with his own. "I know I'm going to like it in here," he said with a darker tone contorting his voice a bit as he spoke.

"That's it, my boy," chuckled Scar. "Embrace it and surpass even me. By the time you emerge, you will truly be Simba the Behemoth. Now my King, it is time to feed!"

"I thought you'd never get to that part," replied Simba as he attacked the food in a ravenous display of savage eating.
14111211121221222.title: Living In Darkness

choices: Nala Comes To Be His Queen
141112111212212222.content:
Simba yawned loudly as his tremendous meal drained away his strength and made him sleepy. He tried to fight the desire to sleep, but several more yawns and he was on the ground and couldn't get up.

"Scar can handle it," Simba thought as he closed his eyes.

As he slept, he dreamt of his reign once all the Pridelands were his. The Sky was dark and he could feel the thunder from his perch at the top. He was huge; a true behemoth to support his name. Animals came from all over to climb Pride Rock and his endless flab to be eaten and increase his size more and more.

When he wanted to address his people, he let out a massive roar to call all the lions and hyenas to him. As they approached, they were terribly thin from nearly all their food going to their king. They were lucky to eat every other day, but saw Simba as more than a king. He was a God and in Simba's dream, that was truly the case. With merely a desire, he could create a mountain and make it erupt. His breaths were terrible typhoons and his belches made the ground split and he did so with great satisfaction. The darkness in his heart made him enjoy the use of his endless power and how on the slightest whim he could smite them all.

"It is good to be king," he cackled, his voice making his subjects cower in fear.

He felt like this dream could not get any better.
141112111212212222.title: Dream A Darker Dream

choices: "You handle it.  I need more food to satisfy my hunger."
1411121112122122221.content:
Unfortunately for all good dreams they always end too soon. In this case, it was because Scar was nudging at his side. If it had been anyone else he'd have ordered them to be put to death and end up as food for him. It didn't matter even if it was another lion and considered cannibalism To him, Simba was an entirely different animal altogether and knew they should feel honored to become a part of their messiah. He felt it was a fate too good for them, but they were lucky to have a ruler who was so benevolent.

"I have great news to report," stated Scar.

"I'll be the judge of that," answered Simba getting up and stretching. He prowled around Scar as he took the time to fully awaken. "Speak now, Scar."

"Yes my sire," replied Scar bowing to him. "While our forces were coming together a most unexpected thing occurred. The lions your father, the soon to be ex-king, banished to the bad lands, including my side of the family have arrived. I had planned to get in touch with them after the battle ended or if we needed more support should the war begin to turn away from our favor. However, some of the lions were scouting the edge of the Pride Lands in order to scout out some food here. They spotted some of our hyena messengers and went to investigate. Hearing that I was involved in this battle prompted them to get involved knowing I would be able to let them return here. I've already discussed it a bit about them joining our forces and they will come to fight for us, but only if we grant them their liberty afterwards. This union will also allow for both sides to combine their territory in the end meaning you'd gain even more ground than we both expected you'd get at first."

"Well that is wonderful indeed," said Simba, his maw leaking drool as he imagined the land he'd get from this conquest as a fatty piece of steak. Getting the land from the bad lands meant he'd just get an even bigger piece that before and it only intensified his hunger more. It was so powerful it made his belly growl for more food to fill it and it echoed through the caves.

"The news only gets better from there," added Scar. "Seems word got back to Pride Rock of the sudden boost in our forces. The gap in our forces and there was already huge and getting bigger as more hyenas arrived. The lions could use their superior strength to counter the hyenas. However, with the addition of lions just as powerful and even fiercer and more savage since their exile any advantage they had is gone. Mufasa probably hoped gaining intelligence on us would give them ore of an advantage, but all it did was demoralize most of his forces. Some felt the battle was going to be a slaughter on their side they've come to join us here and save their skin. Whatever he had left when we attack our forces will crush them in a matter of hours and then you can finally take your rightful place as king."

"And then I will continue from their until I am god to this whole world," cackled Simba.

"But of course," replied Scar.

Suddenly a hyena arrived. "Scar, sir," he said in a humble tone. He was cautious of upsetting Scar, but being in the presence of Simba was enough to take the chuckle from his throat. Though Simba didn't even realize it himself he was already far darker than Scar ever was. Scar was made dark from his constant resentment of hid brother becoming king over him, but that wasn't until he was a young adult. Simba, on the other hand, was much younger and his heart still had fertile soil as he was still finding himself. When Scar planted this darkness in him it ravaged his being from the inside out like a weed growing uncontrollably and choking the life out of the love and light Simba had. To Simba, darkness wasn't merely a thing that he had come to possess, but a thing that had possessed him. It was a power that he hoped to one day totally consume him and then consume the world too.

"What is it?" asked Scar.

"The lions are here to finalize the details for our alliance," he explained. "They need to talk to you now."

"Very good," replied Scar. "Simba, shall we meet them?"

Simba replied...
1411121112122122221.title: Amassing the Forces

choices: The Plan Works and the Pridelands fall into Simba's paws.
The Plan proves successful, but Nala prepares a final assault to stop them.
14111211121221222211.content:
Scar grinned hearing that word of paternal love and watched Simba walk to meet the troops. The more time they spent the more it filled him with pride that he had raised such a great king, at least in his eyes. Simba's belly rumbled a bit in ravenous hunger and Scar turned to a hyena.

"Don't just stand there," he ordered. "My beloved son and your king is hungry. Make sure this place is packed with food by the time he gets back."

"More food," cried the hyena feeling quite hungry himself. "He eats more in one meal than all the hyenas combined in one day. There is no way we can satisfy him forever."

"Bring him what you can," replied Scar. "Once the Pride is ours we will soon have all the food any of us could ever need so don't worry your tiny little brain and just follow my orders."

"As you wish," the hyena replied as he walked off to do Scar's bidding while Scar went to join Simba who was already looking at all the lions they had managed to bring into their army.

Right away, they were amazed to see a lion as big as Simba. He was big not just from fat, but size as well. When he spoke his voice was thunderous and made them all feel like kittens. Any that were holding back any thoughts of how silly and fat he appeared lost that humor.

"I see you've come to fear and respect your new king Simba the Behemoth," stated Scar as he entered the room. "A wise decision and even wiser to join the side that shall soon control everything. First off, there are two things we must make sure to accomplish to win this war. The first is to capture all food sources that the Pridelanders have. Their food is very limited already and quickly drawing more to join our cause. The other thing we must do is hunt down all the animals that provide us with food, but be careful not to harm them. They are important for my brilliant plan to create a true paradise for everyone that Mufasa could never imagine in his prime or now. If you understand this roar."

Soon the room was full of the sounds of lions growling. Simba and Scar grinned hearing such support for this. Simba had no idea what Scar was planning, but knew it was for him, the bond they had kept them from ever being able to betray one another and there was no gain in doing so at this point.

"It is a great plan," Simba told Scar. "But I wish to add one more thing to this plan. Nala, order her captured and brought to me."

"Whatever for?" asked Scar not questioning him, but wanting to see what his beloved son had in mind.

"I still love her and just as you shaped me I know she will come around in time so that I can have my king and soon an heir to the throne. I think you would love being able to have a grandson and nurture him just as you did for me."

"Nothing could make me happier now," replied Scar with a tear in his eyes. He turned to the lions who weren't as sure how to feel about what they were seeing. "Don't just stand there," he roared. "You have your orders start moving." He turned back to Simba. "And a feast awaits you back in your lair."
14111211121221222211.title: Battle Plans

choices: Nala eventually chooses to side with Simba.
Nala goes the whole week without eating and still refuses Simba.
141112111212212222112.content:
Scars tactics proved extremely effective as one area after another of the Pridelands came under there control. They didn't need to occupy the land, but simply remove all the food so it became worthless to the lions under Mufasa's command. Day by day more lions went without eating and their efforts waned as they could barely muster the strength or morale to keep going. Many defected to join Scar's side just to eat and Scar welcomed them in, grinning to see so many lions so thing their skeletons were showing quite clear under their fur, which greatly contrasted with Simba who was obese beyond what they could imagine. Any of the new recruits that saw Simba saw this as the promise of a paradise, though they were quick to learn their place beneath Simba's massive paws.

Scar recruited a lot of the new joiners to be Simba's personal attendants, to cater to his every whim, but to feed him as the hyenas still did that, but anything else he needed from being groomed to being toys for his wicked cravings. The lions were glad to do anything so long as they got fed and Simba didn't hold back on what he did to them from sitting on them to making the lick his feet. Some massaged his blubber and that was a task that took hours. If Simba's titles had been merely that before he certain was living up to it now.

"The war is progressing as planned," Scar reported to Simba one day. "Only a small number of lions remain out of our control. This includes, of course your parents and some of their more loyal followers."

"And Nala I assume?" asked Simba while a dozen lions were licking his body to groom him. "I was hoping Nala would be by my side by now."

"She is very willful, but I suspect they will be launching a last assault on us inevitably leading to our total victory. We will capture Nala then and bring her to."

"Try not to hurt her too much," he told Scar. "I want her unharmed so I can bring her around to our side."

"What if she doesn't?"

"Then I will break her spirit and find a more pitiful use for her. I can always find a new queen elsewhere."

"Indeed you can my lord."

Just as Scar predicted, Mufasa and Nala soon arrived with their meager forced for an attack. They were thin as can be from rationing all their food and now they had no choice but to fight against overwhelming odds or die. If hunger did nothing else it made them desperate and aggressive. They attacked without holding back, but despite some minor success at the start they didn't have the strength to endure and lion after lion was defeated. In a matter of minutes war had ended and Scar signaled for all the lions to roar so Simba the Behemoth could hear. The roars echoed through the cave and reached his ears. In response, Simba grinned showing his pointy teeth. Drool dripped from his muzzle and down his chin. The lions around him fled like kittens as they sensed the excitement in him. Simba had been in the cave for a while now allowing his vileness to grow as the ate. It was almost like it had mutated Simba from the inside out until he was no longer a lion, but a monster, a behemoth. It was something Scar had never expected to happen to Simba, but it was far beyond his control what happened to Simba. If he wasn't so sure Simba needed him he'd be afraid he created a monster that would be the end of everything, but even Simba had his limits and he didn't have the experience as a king do to much without his uncle.

Simba let out a roar that was more monster than lion as it shook the ground and frightened the heavens. It was the signal that Simba was accepting their unconditional surrender. Mufasa and the lions who had chose to fight to the end were all led away to find their fate for defying them to the end, all except Nala. She was brought to Simba, but she couldn't even look at him. She hated him for what he had become. To her, Simba was dead and this was a monster in his skin.

"I give you the chance to be my queen," he told her. "You will find my way of life will lead the Pridelands to a new paradise. Why would you want to deny everyone that?"

"It is wrong. All of this," Nala argued. "I won't have any part of it."

"Well let's see how you think after another week without food," he told her. "If you change your mind you can become my queen. If you survive and refuse then you can join the other who defied me, but that would be a shame to let your beauty go to waste."
141112111212212222112.title: The Last Stand

choices: Nala learns the ins and outs of Simba's Kingdom.
Simba decides to find his new queen.
1411121112122122221122.content:
For Simba a week passed by fast, but for Nala who was growing weaker by the day it was like an eternity. Her already skinny body had grown even skinnier with no food making her body look frail and skeletal. Simba on the other and hand grew even fatter, eating much more plentiful than before as if to mock Nala's struggle.

"I think it's just about time for Nala to come out," he ordered to some hyenas who were there to cater to his every whim. They quickly worked to pull Nala out, finding her as light as a cub. When she was out she was helped over to Simba who was larger than ever, but there was something different about him then when she last saw him. She knew he was hardly the Simba she knew before, but he didn't seem quite as malicious as before. "Hello Nala. Have you made your decision yet?"

"It is the same as it has always been. I will never be your queen."

"Are you sure?" he asked. "We are betrothed to one another anyway."

"That was with the Simba who was my friend, not a monster like you?" she spat. "You are a cruel king who does nothing but harms his people and the world around him."

"Well why don't we ask a few what they think of my reign as king," he stated with a big smile. Nala thought she could see a faint resemblance of him. It didn't make sense as to why he would be like this now.

"King Simba is the greatest king ever," said a lion who was a bit less scrawny than Nala. His words sounded honest and he didn't seem to feel threatened to answer any different.

"Simba's reign is truly one that will guarentee everlasting peace and harmony for all animals on his pride," replied a female hyena. Over a dozen lions, hyenas, and other animals came to profess who happy they were with Simba's rule and Simba merely beamed with pride.

"Now do you see?" he asked.

"I don't," she replied. "How can they say such things when you are a tyrant?"

"I am a tyrant, but it was all to create a utopia that Scar dreamed up for me to rule," he explained. "It has only been a week, but things are going well and already all my people are happier now then they ever have been under my old father. I'd go into more details, but you will see when you go to work."

"Work?" she groaned still feeling weak.

"You'll get some food to get your strength back, but after that you will have to work hard to be able to eat. The most basic rule of all this is everyone must work or you don't get fed. That goes for all animals from the cubs when they learn to pounce to the elders who much teach pouncing."

"And this is the end of your cruel reign?" she asked.

"Not at all," Simba replied showing his devious smirk. "That hasn't changed, but when you are happy there is no reason not to smile. But rest assured, I have lots more land to conquer and my dark nature will not sleep for very long. It is just a shame that you won't be around to see how great I will come."

Simba signaled for her to be taken away while Simba thought about what to do about his queen situation.
1411121112122122221122.title: The Kingdom of Simba

14111211121221222211222.content:
"It was a pity to lose Nala," sighed Simba feeling it was such a waste of a lioness in her prime to end up on the bottom of Simba's empire and with a rear that could eclipse the sun it was a bad place to be. Still, it left the problem open as to what was to be done about Simba's queen.

"I assume by the sight of Nala being led off by hyenas that she did not see things our way," Scar commented as he entered the room. Simba was astounded that his beloved uncle turned father would just show up when he was in need of him. "Luckily there's always plenty of fish in the sea."

"Fish are nice, but I want my queen and I doubt there is another as suitable for me as Nala."

"The old you perhaps, but you desrve a queen who respects your power and will obey your desires," stated Scar to his pampered prince. "What you deserve is a queen who is all that and more and I've gone through the trouble to find the best matches on the planet for you."

"You have?" replied Simba with great surprise and excitement.

"Well not quite that," admitted Scar but I have at least looked far and wide over the Pridelands and found you two lionesses capable of bearing you a child and loving you as Nala could not."

"Bring them in," replied Simba excitedly, but his face blushed red as he lacked some experience that Scar had not had time for during their conquest of the Pridelands. "Would it be too much trouble to learn of the birds and the bees?"

"Did we never go over that?" asked Scar with surprise. Simba nodded a little to verify. "We shall, but for now choose the one best suited for you."

Scar took his leave as two young lionesses came in.The first was one that was still young and yet to mature into an adult, but looked like it was about her time to. She was a bit more slender than Nala had been and her fur was a paler yellow than most lions in the Pride. Her sweet smile showed how pure and unspoiled she was, but would easily change once Simba had his way with her.

"My name is Suzu," she told Simba.

Thatwas all she told him before the next lioness presented herself. She was quite different, her fur was darker and ruffled showing that she was a great hunter. Simba recalled seeing her back in his youner days. She was a child prodigy for hunting and was more skilled than Nala was. Her body was this, but stongly built. The onlyt reason Simba assumed she was her in hopes that she'd be finally relieved of the job for good, somethin Spyro could understand. The way she looked it was clear that she was not simply doing this for an easier time, but she also desired a mate as well.

"My name is Anze," she told him.

He just met them so soon and not he had a major decision to meke over which would become his quieen. Both had their strengths and weaknesses and Simba would have wanted both if he could have been allowed, but one was all he could handle at the moment. After several minutes of contemplation he made his decision.
14111211121221222211222.title: Suzu and Anze

choices: After The Conversation, Simba Wants To Mate Right Away With Suzu
After The Conversation, Simba Wants To Fatten And Evil Up Suzu
141112111212212222112221.content:
After debating for a few minutes, Simba came up with a final decision.

"Both of you are great, but I feel like one will be suited better for me in the long run," Simba said as everyone felt the suspense of waiting for the name. "But in the end, Suzu, will you become my Queen of the Pridelands?" Simba asked with an evil, but charming appeal.

"What ever you command, my King," Suzu said with a burst of innocent excitement. She happily went over to Simba's side and nuzzled her head into his bulk. Simba was already getting excited.

"Thank you, ladies. Every one, please head outside. Suzu, wait outside and we will begin preparations for you," Scar commanded. Everyone did as he asked and soon enough, the room was clear.

"So why Suzu?" Scar asked with curiosity, but not dissapproval to the decision.

"Well, for one, she is young, which means she will last longer. Also, I find her skinny body very attractive. I will find it even more attractive when she begins to fatten up from my spoiling regime. Also, she has some innocence that I noticed in her. I want to turn that around into a pure evil, but lovely thing," Simba said logically to Scar.

"Very wise, my dear Simba," Scar said with happiness.

"Yes. But now, can we please talk about the birds and the bees?" Simba asked.

Now, Scar began to feel a bit of nervousness for this discussion.
141112111212212222112221.title: Suzu Is The Queen

choices: Over the upcomming months, Suzu has bizarre cravings.
The day comes when the baby is finally born.
1411121112122122221122211.content:
Scar's lecture on love was one of his shorter and simpler speeches and his silver tongue seemed rusty as he tried to find the proper words. By the end, Scar stumbled off, hardly appearing the evil lion that had raised Simba. On the other hand, Simba grinned finding the information incredibly helpful, in particular the part about where babies come from was by far the best part. He hadn't told anyone, though he was at the age that everyone assumed he had become sexually active. In fact, before now Simba had no idea what those urges were and only assumed it was just the euphoria of evil. Now that he was informed he felt just as lustful as hungry and all that energy was pointed as Suzu. With one growl he cleared the room save for Suzu and himself. He approached the young lioness and while she didn't cower in fear she could sense he was up to something.

"Is there something I can help you with my king?" she asked.

"Just tell me that you are in heat," cackled Simba. The cave echoed with the roars of Simba and the wails of Suzu in agony. It lasted only a short time, but it was enough to scary everyone in earshot.

Less than an hour later, the deed had been done. Simba pressed a hang on Szdu's belly and smiled. It was swollen what Simba had fiilled her with, but what made Simba so happy was the newborn life she was carrying inside of her.

"You will take propper care of our child," explained Smba. "After all, after us, he will be the one to tale over as king."

Suzu, exhausted from Simba's actions and injured from him as evidence by the claw marks on her body said nothing to defy Simba. Instead she forced her smile and answered him just like before. "Of course my king."
1411121112122122221122211.title: Dark Seed

choices: A fearful rebellion gets formed against Simba and Suzu.
Time passes and the baby is finally born.
14111211121221222211222111.content:
Time passed and the child within Suzu grew and matured. In that time, Simba the Behemoth had continued to grow his kingdom further and further in all directions. With Scar to help him, he had selected a group of his fiercest and most loyal lions and lionesses and even some other beasts they deemed worthy to become his generals and lead their forces where they were not able to be at the time. The world they discovered beyond the Pridelands was even more vast than any of them expected, but that didn't make them hesitate from conquering it first and asking questions later.

Simba's army was constantly starving and devoured whatever prey they encountered, just as Scar had planned. They soldiers were carried on their stomach and at each new territory they created farms to feed and fatten the fodder animals to become a new food source for everyone. Naturally, a generous portion of the best fodder animals was brought back to the Pridelands for Simba to enjoy. The great, fat king had continued to grow bigger and fatter in that time, his size vastly larger than an elephant and weighed more than a herd of them. Pride Rock was hardly a home to the lions now as much as it was a throne befitting his size.

His queen, Suzu had grown considerably larger too, still not near the size of an elephant, but with all the food she was fed to keep her fattening up, she was making quicker progress than Simba had. Another reason, of course was the child she was bearing. It increased her appetite considerably and gave her strange cravings. She desired quite bloody meat, devouring so much it stained her fur red. As she once was, she'd have been terrified by the monster she seemed to become, but she had learned fast under Simba and became just as devilish as him. They feared her as much as they did Simba and word quickly spread how they feared just what kind of beast their child would be once it was finally born.
14111211121221222211222111.title: Bloody Feast

141112111212212222112221111.content: A rebellion was started against Simba and was quickly put down. The leaders of the rebellion Nala and Zazu were brought to Simba and publicity executed by Simba...
141112111212212222112221111.title: A fearful rebellion gets formed against Simba a...

choices: It's a boy named him Kuvo
It's a girl named her Kira
141112111212212222112221112.content: Time passes and the baby is finally born. It's a_who thy named..,
141112111212212222112221112.title: Time passes and the baby is finally born.

choices: What goes on while Suzu is that the temple.
1411121112122122221122212.content:
After a very awkward talk that had Simba finding new ways to exert his evil energy he knew he had to return his focus to Suzu and making her be the queen he desired. "Uncle Scar," he said. "There is something else I need to ask you."

"If it is about what goes in where, give me a bit more time to recover. That talk is exhausting," moaned Scar.

"No. I want to send Suzu to the temple so that she can undergo the same treatment that I went under. It will help her become the queen I desire and deserve."

"Are you sure?" asked Scar. "It won't be easy and she might not endure as you have."

"Then it means she wasn't worthy and I must seek out another," stated Simba. "Send her off and make sure she is made to match my own size. Make sure she eats and develops fast. I want her not only to be evil and fat, but ready to give her body to me. She will not only be my queen, but my lover and my desires are shouting out of all my pores at this moment."

"As you wish, Simba," answered Scar with a bow and went off to have Suzu sent to the temple.
1411121112122122221122212.title: Back to the Temple

choices: A Week Later, She Turns Out To Be What Simba Wants
Scar Finds A Fancy For Her
14111211121221222211222122.content:
"But it is so much food," Suzu said to one of the hyenas.

"Yes, but it would be rude if our Queen didn't eat what we hunted for her," one of the hyenas laughed.

"Well thank you," she replied.

"Our Queen should never thank us," a hyena yelled.

"Why?" She asked.

"We like fear," another hyena said in a low growl.

Suzu shook her head and began digging into a hippo carcus. Immediately, she couldn't help but continue to eat as she found the meat to be the best tasting ever. She felt ravenous as she dug in like a pig. After a half hour, her belly was extended with no signs of meat as she had eaten it all.

"More," she yelled.

None of the hyenas moved.

"I SAID, MORE!" She yelled with a harsh tone making the hyenas scramble.

She was starting to see Simba's side.
14111211121221222211222122.title: Suzu Machinations

choices: Simba Is Patient And He Waits For A Larger Army
Simba Is Too Ambitious And He Wants To Attack Right Away
14111211122.content:
Scar saw the greedy look in Simba's eyes. it was the very same one that Scar had in his for all the power he could grasp in his paws.

"The Pridelands do make this place seem insignificant. But do you really need to conquer it? After all, it is your birthright."

"I want it now," explained Simba.

"But are you willing to fight your father and your family for it?"

"I don't care about my relations or my father. They have nothing to do with this. It is about whether they can keep the Pridelands of if I can take it away. Scar, I will need an army of hundreds... no thousands of hyenas. Summon them all here at once."

"I would love to," said Scar, "But it will take time. The different zebra tribes are spread out throughout the remote areas of the Pridelands and even I have waning controls over most of them. Bringing them all here at once would only invite them to do as they please. We will either have to bring them here one tribe at a time or only use the tribes that I have total influence on. We will be able to move sooner, but all the weaker as a result. The first choice may take longer, months even, but it will allow you time to grow and mature. Decide the best course of action, for it will decide your fate and that of the Pridelands."
14111211122.title: Preparing The Attack

choices: "I'll Return To The Pridelands And Do The Dividing Myself!"
"I Will Make Short Of The Prideland's Food Supply!"
141112111221.content:
"There is no rush," said Simba calmly. "A few months, a few years, it makes no difference as long as the Pridelands will inevitably be mine."

"Ah, that is a good answer, my king," said Scar. "You're drive for power does not cloud your judgement. I will begin to make the preparations, but there is one thing you must consider now..."

"What is that?" asked Simba. "What my first decree will be?"

"Where will you be?" asked Scar. "As I rally the troops, you must figure out where you will be. You are, after all, the piece that can decide this battle. Even with all the hyenas, the Pridelands are strong as long as they remain united. I had plans of severing such bonds by means of killing your father and exiling you, but as you are no longer a piece I can play with, that is no longer an option."

Simba thought about this for a moment before he came up with an idea that made his lips twist and contort into a fiendish smile. It was a wonderfully awful idea.
141112111221.title: Patience Is A Virtue

1411121112211.content:
Of course, Simba's words were easier said than done. With his increased girth, getting himself back home was going to be a lot more difficult than it was bringing him there.

"It may take some time to prepare a proper mode of transportation," explained Scar. "Until then, just relax and feast while I have the hyenas prepare something!"

Some time was right as the hyenas weren't the most skilled craftsmen. Their early designs broke before Simba even got to try them out and later models broke under his weight. One model almost seemed to work, but after a lunch break, his weight increased and it smashed under his weight. This of course forced the hyenas to carry their mammoth king back home themselves.

After weeks of trial and error, however, they did manage to make something that did work and finally brought Simba out of the Jungle and into the Savanna. It didn't look like it had changed at all, but Simba sure had. He was the fattest lion he had ever seen. His stomach lifted him off the ground and made his legs as meaty as any hippos. If you asked any of the hyenas, his rear was truly a terror. They had many misfortunes of getting sat on when he was displeased and Simba took every opportunity to make them suffer as it was part of his new evil demeanor.

Of course, Simba changed in more than just weight and mind. He had gotten older and matured a bit in his time away. His body grew larger, though not catching up to his weight. He also gained a tuft of brownish red hair on his head, showing the earlier signs of a mane coming in. His roar had also developed, making him sound even more terrifying when he was hungry.

When he made it to the edge of the Pridelands, he had to make the rest of the trip himself. It wouldn't look good to show up with hyenas, let alone, in a chariot pulled by them. Lugging his weight was a chore that he wasn't planning on getting used to. When he made it to Pride Rock, he happened to run into Nala who had also developed a lot since he left. When she saw him, she just stared at him in awe and disbelief. Simba had come at that age and Scar did give that talk (and you can imagine what that was like), but he knew such things would be better for later. For now, he had to act like his old self.

"Simba, I can't believe my eyes. You're alive and... huge!"

"Well, it's good to see you too!" Simba said with a grin.

"Sorry, but when you just vanished for so long, we all thought you were dead. But by the way, you look like you've been flourishing!" Nala said to Simba.

"Maybe I'm not such a bad hunter then after all," lied Simba, figuring that may be the best way to cover himself for now. "Is my father home? I want to surprise him. Also, there's something I need to address to the Pridelands. It's very important. Can you call a meeting?"

"This is all so sudden," she began.

"Please," said Simba in a dark tone that Scar often used on them when they were young. He stared into her eyes making her speechless. She just nodded and left.

"This is going to be easier than I thought," smirked Simba, making his way up Pride Rock.

Workd quickly spread as Simba made his way to his father. The animals were also starting to arrive at Pride Rock, interested to see what he had to say. At the summit was Simba's parents just as surprised as Nala had been when she saw them.

"Simba," began his father, almost in tears of seeing his son alive. Simba didn't seem as emotional at this reunion, his corrupted nature hidden just below the surface. As the crowd was almost ready to hear what he had to say, he had to decide if he should speak with his parents first or greet the Pridelands first.
1411121112211.title: Return Of The "Prince"

choices: Simba Doesn't Stop Until The Laughter Does
141112112.content:
Simba was at a loss for how to respond. He had always thought being a king meant saying stuff and people did it. Even with all of Scar's help he felt helpless now. For the first time in his life, Simba felt like he never wanted to be king. With that thought firmly planted in his head he curled up and began to cry uncontrollably.

Seeing his runt of a nephew soundly defeated, Scar signaled the hyenas to leave the room.

"Don't tell me you're going to give up so easily?" asked Scar, feigning concern.

"I never want to go through that again," cried Simba. "I just can't be a true king."

"Perhaps, not all of us can command respect," he said twisting his words to make them lower Simba's self-esteem even further. "Some of us are just doomed to be given tasks we have no hope of completing."

"There has to be a way?" begged Simba. "I can't do this. I can never be king."

"Well, there may be a way," began Scar, making sure Simba was going to do it no matter what the order was.

"If you were to vanish from the Pridelands and never return they can never make you be a king," he said logically.

"That's true, but then who would be king?" asked Simba.

"You need not worry about such things," replied Scar. "Just know that it is of none of your concern from this day forward."

"But where can I go?" asked Simba. "I don't want to be alone."

"This place can be your knew home. As for company, the hyenas will always be around to make sure you have food to eat. You would not even need to give them a single order. I will do that for you."

"Th- thanks, Scar," Simba said, his tears drying up.

"I only do it for your best interest," lied Scar. "Now I should head to the Pridelands and report that you have met a horrible end and will not be able to become king."

As Scar left he nodded to the hyenas who started to give the occasional chuckle every few minutes. Upon hearing that dreadful noise Simba started to become upset again. Without Scar there to give him comfort Simba did the only other thing he could think of; he returned to the food before him and scarfed down huge chunks of it hoping the food would make the pain in his heart stop. But just as he felt too sick to eat any more food he heard another horrid laugh and ate more with abandonment.
141112112.title: The Fallen King

choices: Simba Tries To Do It Himself
1411121121.content:
Salty tears filled Simba's meal as he ate and ate. He probably wouldn't have stopped if the hyenas got bored and Scar had left for the Pride Lands. As they stopped Simba felt the fullness hit him with full force and he collapsed on his large gut unable to move a muscle. He was too depressed to move anyway. He didn't feel he deserved it. He ended up sleeping there throughout the night.

In the morning he felt relatively better as he stood up. His belly hung down more than before after digesting his meal. Looking around he had eaten three Zebras while he was out of it. It was a thought that made him sick at first, but then he recalled that he was tasked with eating all the food and despite the way it happened he had made a remarkable dent. Simba didn't like that he couldn't order the hyenas around, but still, they had managed to get him to eat more and that alone gave him a small light of hope.

"Hyenas!" he called. Almost immediately they entered and looked at him. "Feed me."

With that they just burst into laughter again; the bad memories of last night still fresh in his mind. He quickly became saddened and dove back into the food finding the room to fit it in his stomach. He was devouring another Zebra again and was actually noticing how quickly he was finishing it off before moving on to another. The hyenas quickly grew tired of laughing and retreated. Simba tried to remain focused on eating and that sad feeling he had and managed to just fall short of finishing the zebra. He considered having the hyenas return to help him, but he saw how uninteresting it was for them so they wouldn't stay long. He knew he'd have to keep their interest, but that meant further humiliation. Simba didn't like it, but it helped him. On the other hand he could focus on eating it on his own. He was already able to eat a lot more than he used to and if he kept it up he'd finish it in a lot less time than he thought possible.
1411121121.title: Simba Doesn't Stop Until The Laughter Does

choices: Simba Decides He Wants To Go Home
14111211211.content:
Simba called them back in and after several failed attempts, he managed to bother them enough to return. They didn't look amused as much as annoyed. He had only one idea of how to get them back to taunting him, but he was only going to hate himself more than he already did. He walked to them with only one idea of how to get them laughing again. It felt like he was going kill himself inside if he did it, but he doubted he had anything to lose at this point.

He sucked in his gut to look thinner. "I want you to feed me," He said.

"Scar isn't here anymore," One said dully. "He's already begun his campaign to take over the Pride Lands!"
"Yeah," Added another. "He doesn't care about you anymore. You're worthless to him!"
"The only reason we're even still around is because Scar thinks you might have some value as a bargaining chip if he needs one, but who would want you now? Not your parents, not Scar, and definitely not us!"

"I guess you're right," Admitted Simba. "Just look at me," He said as he was letting his stomach drop, causing it to bounce and his fat to jiggle. The hyenas were suprised by the site they just saw. "And look at my rear," He turned for them to take a gander. "I'm so fat, that throne isn't big enough for the two of us!" The hyenas were starting to crack smiles, finding his little display a lot more amusing than his mournful stuffing. "And all his eating is very habit forming," He pulled out a chunk of zebra meat from his stomach. "I keep a few chunks in my folds for eating on the go, but I'm too fat to go anywhere!" This joke got the chuckling, but what they saw next topped even that. Simba sat on his fat rear and hefted his stomach up and shook it. The doughy gut jiggled and danced and jumped in such a ridiculous manner. An eye full of this was enough to have them on the ground cackling as loud as they ever did and they couldn't stop.

Simba went to the food to resume his sorrowful binge, but something was different. He didn't feel sad anymore. He was actually happy. He hadn't been silly and comical like he had been back at the Pridelands and this was the first time he got to be himself. He liked himself again.
14111211211.title: Love Of Self-Loathing Or Heckle To Happiness

choices: "We'd Be Happy To Go With You!"
"You Can Go, But We Won't Come!"
141112112112.content:
While Simba was in higher spirits than he had been in a long time, these happy feelings soon made him reminisce on his real home: the Pridelands. It had been so long since he was there that it felt like it was a dream. Simba also realized that his recent binging had made his movement a lot more sluggish, but it made sense since he was still a cub and probably weighed more than the average adult lion. If he didn't return home soon, he'd eventually get too big to return without losing the weight and deep down, Simba had come to enjoy his obesity and even desired to increase it. Still, he didn't want to continue unless he was in a place that he'd be happy to stay. He knew the hyenas here were a lot friendlier than he first gave them credit for, but it didn't change the fact that he wanted to go home. He figured he could at least talk with them to see if they would return with him. Scar had left them with him and surely they wouldn't have any other reason to stay if he left. Simba was even confident that they would help in preventing Scar's attack on the Pridelands.

With his confidence not diminishing, Simba waddled over to the hyenas. They were already chuckling, seeing him return.

"Got some more material for us kid?" laughed one of the hyenas.

"Maybe he wants to make his belly talk again," replied another.

"I still think the one where he belly flops is the funniest," stated the third.

"No comedy this time, fellas," said Simba. "I want to go home and I was wondering if you wanted to come with me?"

The hyenas stopped laughing. This was something they had never considered. True, they had been loyal to Scar, but they had never expected the lion cub to grow on them as he did. It also crossed their mind that the Pridelands had never been to kind to them and once Scar was in charge, they wouldn't be the outcasts anymore, but they might be welcomed as heroes if they brought Simba back safely, despite being so large and fat now. They huddled together and discussed it before the leader returned to tell Simba their answer. The lead hyena answered for them all.
141112112112.title: Homeward Bound

choices: Scar, Who Was Out Looking For Him
1411121121122.content:
Simba was disappointed that he had to go alone, but he respected their decision and made his way out, wagging his rump around to give them a final chuckle as a way to say goodbye. Once he reached the entrance to the temple, he came to his first obstacle: he didn't know how to get home. He was in that temple so long he couldn't recall the path he took to get here and everything even looked different. Simba eventually found lion tracks and knew the only one they could belong to was Scar. He followed them as best he could into the thick foliage, but before long, he ran out of paw prints to track.

The path was also becoming a lot trickier and he was forced to take detours when his girth made going anywhere else impossible. At times, Simba had to back track when he reached a dead end. The more this happened, the more he became lost. He couldn't even find his way back to the temple and to make matters worse, his sedate and food-filled lifestyle made him weak and quick to tire out. His rumbling stomach quickly became unbearable and in no time at all, he collapsed on the ground. As the great circle in the sky started to set, Simba was filled with dread. Such an obese animal alone and helpless would make any predator's day. He had to pray that nothing would come across his way unless they would offer him something to eat. But such foolhardy thoughts were quickly forgotten when he actually did hear something coming closer.
1411121121122.title: The Journey Of Simba The Obese

choices: They Thought Simba Was Some Sort Of Deity They Wanted To Worship
They Wanted To Fatten Up Simba For Some Special Ritual
14111211211221.content:
Simba watched as the bushes around him shook as someone or something approached him. It was coming from every direction, meaning there was a lot of them and they were surrounding him. He expected some giant and fierce-looking creatures hungry for his meaty haunches and that made his heart pound. When they jumped out, he saw these terrifying creatures that danced around on two legs and had bright colorful faces with large eyes to fit in their equally large heads. If Simba had been calmer, he'd have realized they were wearing masks, but he was so scared he jumped to his feet and ran.

Moments ago, Simba didn't think he could even run and now he was scampering through the jungle, his belly bouncing crazily as he moved. As expected, the creatures chased him. As fast as Simba was moving, they were faster. They didn't run faster than a lion, but he wasn't in the best shape anymore and he was quickly boxed in. They tossed ropes around him and pinned him to the ground. They then used the ropes to tie him up and drag him to their village. He was placed in a cage and left to wait there until morning. Simba was scared, but he was so tired he quickly fell asleep and hoped he'd awaken to find this was just a bad dream.

When his eyes opened, he found he was still behind bars and the whole tribe of creatures were now looking at him from the largest of adults to the youngest children. What they said made no sense to him, but they seemed quite interested in him, particularly over his unusual size. After a while, Simba's stomach growled and it seemed this was the first thing to make them grow quiet. At once, they scattered about and brought to Simba an assortment of meats that they dropped into his cage. Simba was a bit skeptical at first over what they were up to, but hunger got the better of him and he started eating. The meats were brought to him differently, but the tastes were the same. It was then Simba noticed a statue place in the center of their village. He easily recognized it as a lion and a large one at that. It seemed very important to them and quickly Simba had ideas of what they had planned for him.
14111211211221.title: The Tribe

choices: Much Time Passes For Simba With The Tribe
141112112112211.content:
Simba didn't realize it, but this particular tribe was one that worshiped lions. Not only did they see a lion as a creature of strength and power, but life and growth as well. In their eyes, a lion, and a full and meaty one was a sign of good tidings ahead. One could imagine the delight they had in finding Simba so big and round wandering into their territory. The warriors who found him brought him back to their village and announced their find as Simba slept. The elders of the village deemed this find was in fact their Diety, Simbasa, descending from the heavens to better observe those most devoted to him. They agreed that he came in the form of a cub to be raised and cared for by them. Depending on their efforts would result in either their tribe being blessed or or cursed. Not taking any chances, they prepared the finest meats they could find and were prepared to pamper him to ensure his happiness never wavered.

After Simba got done staring at the lion statue he returned to his meat, his recent binges at the temple causing him to develop an exceptionally large appetite for a lion his age but at the same time it convinced the tribe that he was a deity with an unearthly appetite. With no trouble at all he ate all the food they brought him and they didn't stop until he gave any sign that he was content with the meal, usually a belch or a yawn before he stretched and rested on the ground.

Then the villagers would do everything in their power to appease him. The younger ones would take turns petting and rubbing his body to help relax him while the women would brush and groom him, cleaning his hair and taking care of him from head to toe, even taking care of his claws and teeth with no fear that he might lash out at them. They also made sure he had a soft place to rest and digest while the men went out to hunt for more meat for him at the next meal.

At first, Simba was very wary of what their intention was, but it was short lived due to two facts. The first was that he was now hopelessly lost from the Pridelands now that he was taken from the path he was on and now was so turned around that he didn't even have a general idea of where to go. The other was, all the pampering and care-taking that he had been given from first the hyenas and now these strange creatures had become so familiar to him it was almost like an addiction. His self reliance was diminished with his weight slowing him down and his muscles softening. Simba no longer had the drive he did in the days before to hunt; it was far more appealing to simply let these creatures feed and care for him. It was hardly a thing he needed to consider as he practically submitted to this lifestyle after only a few feedings.

With his body already adapted to digesting his meals into fat on his body, Simba fattened up quickly to the villages efforts. His stomach was touching the ground even as he stood and fat clung over every inch of him. His face was so chubby that the way his mouth looked it almost seemed like he was smiling happily convincing the tribe they were really pleasing their god and encouraging them to pamper and feed him more.

The only thing that beat the feedings was the worshiping. Simba didn't know what they were saying, but he understood enough that they were paying him their respects. He didn't think they saw him as highly as a god, but he did think that he was like a king to them and why should he disappoint them?
141112112112211.title: The Lion God

choices: One Of The Village Boys He Had Grown Quite Fond Of
Announce It To The Whole Village Since They Will Only Praise Him More For It
1411121121122111.content:
Simba grew larger by the days and before long, he was truly worth his size as a deity. He was mostly a round blob with legs that didn't come close to the ground. He couldn't eat food on the ground as it was too for for his head to reach past his chest. It was still a point as the villagers made sure to hand feed him. They showed no fear of him biting them. His mood had become as sweet and loving as a lion could and it comforted them that they had pleased their great, big God. At the same time, the village seemed to be thriving more that it had when Simba first arrived. They had good rains and their crops grew in nice and healthy. All their hunting proved very successful, allowing for ample food for Simba and themselves. Simba knew he didn't lift a finger to help; he couldn't budge an inch after all, but things seemed to work out for everything by pure chance, and that was enough for them to continually increase his food portions.

Another unique thing that occurred during his time there was even more amazing. The words that Simba could only identify as mumbles from the villagers started to make sense. He didn't know if it was because he was hearing it so much or if he was connecting more with these strange creatures while he was isolated from other animals. Either way, the more he listened, the clearer it translated until he could hear their words like they spoke the same language.

To Simba, it was a lot better understanding their words as he was able to smile and know how great they thought he was. It made him happy and almost believe he was a God if he didn't truly at times. Understanding them was enough to make him think that. At first, he only seemed to understand them while they praised him. But soon after, any word he caught was clear as another lion's roar. The villagers had no idea of this change in him and conversed near him, unaware of him ease-dropping. Thanks to this, he was able to learn the names of each villager and a little information about them. Smelling their scent was also the one way he was able to identify them, but he could identify differences in appearance and voices. It was a totally different experience for him, though instead of becoming more like a God, he was really becoming more human.

His curiosity into this matter grew. At night, he practiced trying to learn to speak like them. It was easily the hardest thing he had ever tried to do. Like fitting a cube into a round hole, he had to force it before he made any progress. The growls became mumbles and then rasps, but finally, words passed his lips.

"I can talk like them," he whispered excitedly. He was so excited at learning this, but he had to decide just who he was going to share this gift with.
1411121121122111.title: Godliness Is Next To Fatliness
