choices: The tribe gets back to pampering Simba
14111211211221112.content:
Simba anounced "I am you god Simbosa, there is only one thing you can do to make me happy is keep feeding and pampering me."
The tribe…
14111211211221112.title: Announce It To The Whole Village Since They Wil...

choices: They give simba even more food.
1411121121122112.content: Just then another tribe attacks the village, but with there god by their side they easily beat the attacking tribe. They then…
1411121121122112.title: Another Tribe Attacks The Village

choices: Finds Hakuna Matata To Be Too Freeing
141132.title: More Options For Simba

choices: The Lifestyle Continues For Some TIme
1411321.content:
It had been more than three years since Simba had ran away after the awful stampede. Timon and Pumbaa had taken him under their wing ages ago, and the three were inseparable best friends. That wasn't the only change for Simba, though.

As he grew older, and nearly reached maturity, he had become less and less motivated to run, swim, or really do anything but sleep, eat, and lay around. His body was showing the effects of this change as well. His belly hung more than a foot down past his chest, and his midsection had swollen out around six inches past its usual size. His neck was thicker, showing the beginning (and middle) of a double-chin, and his legs were definitely more fleshy than muscled.

What's more, he welcomed this change. In Simba's mind, the less he looked like a king, the less he'd ever have to be king. Why go back to the pridelands when he had two best friends, a lavish jungle, and enough bugs to feed ten lions for life? Speaking of which, he thought, it had been almost an hour since his last snack...
1411321.title: Finds Hakuna Matata To Be Too Freeing

14113211.content:
Another month had gone by, and Simba had fallen even further into his new lifestyle, to be as lazy as lionly possible. And he was getting the results he wanted. Days of lazing by the local river, resting and eating with no cares in the world, put his mind at ease, and he felt peace. He also felt the added weight of his gluttony and laziness. He was really growing out now, and looked as fatty as Pumbaa- only more startling, as a fat lion was rare.

His paunch had grown another few inches, but the real bulk had come in his back and midsection- he had rounded out almost another foot, making him look overstuffed. His legs were thicker than some of the trees around him, and the lion's mane was starting to be overshadowed by his double, almost triple, chin.

Timon and Pumbaa had noticed his change, and asked him if he was feeling OK. "Better than ever, not a care in the world!" came Simba's reply. "I'm honestly as happy as I could ever be. Thank you two so much for all you've done. Come on, let's pig out!" The meerkat and warthog were a bit worried, but figured if he was happy, why stop him? Timon even decided he might indulge a little more often to give Simba more company, too.
14113211.title: This Lifestyle Continues For Some Time

141132111.content:
Simba stretched his arms after awaking from his slumber. His had truely become a shadow of his former self, a very fat shadow. Simba had quickly lost track of his time with Timon and Pumba and each day he just seemed to wake up larger than the last till he became so big his stomach touched the ground when he was on all four paws. Normally, becoming that big would scare of at least shock anyone, but Simba didn't seem to register anything but hakuna matada these days and simply smiled as he awoke Timon and Pumbaa.

They had both decided to join in with Simba on indulging to their hearts' content and gained almost as fast as Simba. Timon's gut was so big not it sloshed whenever he moved, preventing him from moving by himself. If he needed to go anywhere he needed to ride on either Pumbaa or Simba. Pumbaa gained quite a bit as well, filling out similarly to Simba, though Simba had put this so-called pig to shame, often outeating him whenever they ate. He was also beginning to lose his immobility as he gut barely allowed his feet to touch the ground. Simba was only able to stay mobile for so long due to the fact he had still been growing.

As they got up they followed Simba to their current feeding logs. One thing they discovered in the first month of their endless binge fests was that you can't feast without food. They cleaned out entire logs in a single sitting and ended up waking up some days to find their logs bare of their normal bounty of bugs. They learned from this and figured out how to provent this from happening. They toppled over some more trees to attract more juicy bugs for them to eat. They also planned a feeding schedule they would follow so they would know which logs they would go to each day for their fill and by the time they reset back to the first log it would be a smorgesborg once again.

It was hard work to set up, but paid off big time by indication of their ever expanding waistlines. Every once in a while they toppled more trees to increase their food supply as their appetites seemed to grow with their girths.

As they arrived at their first log of the day they...
141132111.title: Fast-Forward Another Few Months

choices: Timon And Pumbaa Come Looking For Him
He Wakes Up And Notices It's Night And Cool
1411321111.content:
As they arrived at their first log of the day, they find it swarming with tasty treats. There was bugs of all kinds crowding it. And they reached the log just in time since Simba was sweating and breathing heavily as his underbelly was sore from being dragged across the ground. With a content sight, Simba drops down and lies on his belly, making it spill out to all sides of him, which makes it hard to reach the bugs. But somehow, he still manages. Next to him, Timon is walking slowly towards his part of the log as his belly sways from side to side. It will make him fall if he moves too fast. Pumbaa was not the fittest but most mobile of them as he was better suited to carry weight more than lions and meercats, but also he found moving to be rather harder.
After about 30 minutes, the log is cleansed and they are lying in the sun feeling their stuffed bodies. The heat makes them all want a swim in the lake and Pumbaa picks up Timon and goes to tell Simba to get moving. Simba, drowsy and stuffed, just tells them to go ahead. Normally, they would have waited, but today was especially hot.
Simba noticed the heat well under both his fur and his enormous bulk. He feels like he is melting and the cool water in the lake is becoming more and more tempting. At last, he can't stand the heat anymore. Stuffed or not, he needs to cool off. He begins to gather his legs so he can push himself up. Once his flabby legs are in place, he begins to push himself up, something he did without thinking before. But now, it's a pain. He is stuffed from all the bugs and his belly is becoming so big, he only gets halfway up before falling down panting wildly. At first, he is shocked, but he remembers hakuna matata and relaxes. He kept on thinking that things will work out and it's probably the heat draining him.
He rests for half an hour before trying again. This time, he gets up a little less before his stamina wears out and he collapses into a panting, yellow mass of fat. Giving up on getting up for now, Simba rolls over to his side and falls asleep, his belly rising like a mountain above him.
1411321111.title: Find It Swarming With Tasty Treats

choices: Simba falls asleep next to them
14113211112.content:
Simba woke up in the cool night air. He felt it all around. He was still by the log the three had cleansed earlier. Simba moves around slightly in attempt to move his fat body. He tries to move his huge body across the floor, but he fails. He fell to the forest floor with a thud loud enough to make any okapi in a 5 mile radius of him run away. It seemed he'd not be able to be quite as mobile. Trying to think, he looks for some water in close range. He finds a coconut looking fruit. He breaks the fruit and a liquid spills out onto the dirt. Using the muddy substance, Simba dragged his body across the jungle floor for a good 3 feet before he fell again.

Willing himself to get up again, Simba forces his legs up. A dull pain shot through his legs. He treaded along the hardly visible path they had once came, his mass dragging along the forest floor. After a few minutes, Sima finds Timon and Pumbaa resting in the grass...
14113211112.title: He Wakes Up And Notices It's Night And Cool

choices: Simba, Timon And Pumbaa Taking Care Of Nala
1411321112.content:
As Simba, Timon and Pumbaa made their way to the first log at the outskirts of the jungle, they saw something that was lying on it. Something big.

It was a full-grown lioness whose colors on the fur seemed familiar to Simba. She was laying over the log unconscious. Of the skinniness of her body it looked like she hadn’t been eating for a long time.

Simba rushed (To both his friends and himself surprise given the state of his body.) towards the weaken lioness. He was just ten feet away from the log when he had seen the lioness, but it felt as exhausting for Simba like running seven miles. For every step he took his hundreds of pounds belly would slam into the ground and get in the way of his turkey stuffed legs. His breath became very deep very quickly, too. He felt so warm and painful in his muscles that he thought that he would collapse before reaching the end.

Even though Simba didn't know who the lioness was, he ran towards her like she was someone he would want to protect.

After what felt like an eternity (but actually was about a minute), Simba reached the lioness on the log. While still breathing heavily because of the running, Simba took one paw and lifted up the lionesses' head so he could see her face.

“This can't be right!” Simba thought when he saw the face of the lioness. But before he could do anything else, the lioness woke up by the sound of his breathing.

“S-Simba?” The lioness said in a weak voice.

“Nala,” Simba replied. Even though she could only see his face, Nala didn’t belive it was Simba first. His face was so rounded and fat looking like his neck had been pulled down into his body. But she thought that it was probably due to the sun and the fact that she hadn't been eaten for so long that had made her vision look so strange.

She was on her way to say something more when she lost consciousness again. Simba knew that she needed to be in the shadows and get some water and food. He took and laid her on his back and made his way back to he and his friend’s home.

Even though he was carrying a 200-pound lioness on his back, Simba's determination to give her help gave him strength to walk back like she was nothing. His walk cycle back into the jungle made him almost look like he wasn't morbidly obese. He took great powerful steps, kept his stomach in place so it wasn't swaying around with every step he took, and he even had control over his breathing pace so he didn't get short on breaths.

On his way back, he saw that Timon and Pumbaa had tried to follow him, but given that their body's were even fatter in comparison to Simba's, they had only managed to get halfway the distance before giving up. Timon is so all around fat that he can't even walk. And Pumbaa can barely walk with his bloated belly. So when going somewhere, Pumbaa had to carry the very overweight Timon with him on his back. And this time, doing it in a hurry to catch up to Simba proved too much for them. Seeing Simba, Timon said breathless, “We w-where about to get to you Simba!”

“That's nice of you guys,” Simba said. “But I've got this fixed and we have to get back home now!”

Timon and Pumbaa sighed a bit, knowing that after they finally had caught up to Simba after only getting halfway now, had to head back the same way again.
1411321112.title: ...Find Someone Over By The Log

14113211121.content:
As Simba, Timon and Pumbaa carry the unconscious Nala back into the jungle, Simba thought about how the lioness that he had known since they were cubs, and not been seeing since he had ran away after his father's death, now had been found lying unconscious and almost dead looking just outside the jungle.

As they finally reached the goal that was their sleeping place where it was closer to water and shade, Simba took and collected some water in a bowl fold leaf, and held it close to Nala's face so she could take some sips of the cold water.

Still being very weak made it not possible for her to talk to Simba.

“So, would you like to tell us who this is?” Timon asked.

“This is Nala,” Simba answered. “We were best friends when we were cubs, but since my banishing from my home pride, I haven't known anything about what happen to her or why she's here,” Simba continued.

“Do you think she was searching for you?” Pumbaa asked.

“I don't know, but I hope that she gets better so I can ask her some questions,” Simba replied.

Even thought they had water and shade to share to Nala, Simba was unsure of what they should feed her.

There where two alternatives.

Either they all three could take and collect bugs for Nala to eat. Being that they were so small in size and the weak state of Nala meant that they were going to have to feed her huge masses of bugs. The only downside is that bugs have a weird effect on lions, as Simba was a living example on being very filling with fat if they are consumed in large doses with little or no moving activity to it. This means that giving Nala them would help her get better and they are easy to get to her, but giving that she would probably not have the energy to move for some days would make her very fat. Not as fat as Simba, but still, not normal for a lion.

The other alternative is for Simba to go out and hunt after some prey for Nala. Being that he, Timon and Pumbaa hadn't been eating anything else but bugs since Simba's arrival, the jungle now had it's fair share of zebras, antelopes, gazelles, and other favorite foods for lions. The problem here was that it was usually female lions that did the hunting, while the males job was to protect the pack from other males wanting to take the position as leader. To make things worse, Simba wasn't in his best shape. He had previously had a hard time running to an unconscious Nala on a log before. How hard wouldn't it be for Simba to sneak up and to catch up to prey?

Which way of getting food should he choose?
14113211121.title: Simba, Timon And Pumbaa Taking Care Of Nala

choices: Nala Is Healthy Enough To Talk
Simba Has To Hunt For More
141132111212.content:
Simba knew that what Nala really needed to eat was the same thing that he himself would have dined on: Meat. Meat from zebra, gazelle and/or antelope. Even though males didn’t usually hunt and he himself was nowhere near fit for hunting, he knew that if he didn't try to do anything now, she would die!

So he ordered Timon and Pumbaa to look after Nala while he went out searching for food.

As Simba tried to get used to walking a longer distance, he knew that he also needed a strategy if he was going to capture something. A “real” lion wouldn’t have any problems running up to a prey and kill it, but since Simba could hardly walk normally, he knew he must try to surprise his prey or he wouldn't succeed. As he walked (or actually waddled) deeper into the jungle, he saw a zebra. And not only that, but it was a very fat zebra.

“It seems the lazy jungle life didn’t only change me and my friends,” Simba thought. But even though the zebra was big in size, it still looked like it could run off without problems, which was more than you could say about the so called “king of the jungle!”

Simba first felt like he was about to give up on the whole thing. When his mind tells him that a big bellied, lonely zebra would be too hard for him to catch, then he wouldn't be able to hunt anything. But then, he remembered the weak and hungry Nala and how he was her only hope of saving her from starvation. So he got his thoughts together and started to search the area for a way to make an easy kill.

The zebra was in a small clearing area with many trees surrounding it. There were still some openings, meaning that if Simba tried to block one entrance, the zebra would still escape through another. He also saw that it wasn't only trees surrounding the area. There was a small cliff (about 10 feet's tall) that was also shielding the area. Simba saw that the zebra was eating grass near the bottom of the cliff, giving Simba an idea.

Slowly and carefully, Simba took and tried to sneakily climb up the cliff from behind. This plan he had wasn't very thought-out. It actually sounded very stupid when thinking about it too much. His plan was to jump down from the cliff right on top of the zebra and slice it with his claws and teeth. Climbing up this small cliff turned out to be one of the hardest and most exhausting things that he ever put his body through. He could barley reach up his front paws to grab the ground above because his arms were so heavy with fat and so low on muscles that they almost did not obey him. His hind legs had trouble, too. It was almost impossible for them to step forward and help push his body up to the top of the cliff because his big hanging belly got in the way of his legs.

After finally reaching the top, Simba took a minute to catch his breath before looking over the edge to see if the zebra was still there. Luckily for him it was.

“Okay” Simba thought. “Now or never!”

And with that, Simba leaped off. During the fall, Simba discovered that the air resistance made his arms and legs go out to it sides, pining him in an awkward falling position. As he was falling down towards the zebra, the zebra didn't notice anything at first. But then, it saw a big shadow form itself around it. It reached it's head up and saw a big fleshy belly of a lion before it all turned dark for the zebra.

Simba's fall ended with him falling belly first on top of the zebra, crushing the zebra's neck and back with his added weight. He had been afraid of getting hurt by the fall, but to his surprise, the zebra had slowed down his fall speed enough for him to be unharmed.

Looking at the zebra corpse, he couldn't believe it at first. He had somehow with his useless body and poorly thought out plan actually managed to kill prey.

He had made a successful hunt.
141132111212.title: The Fat Hunter

choices: “Okay, but only for a little while.”
1411321112121.content:
When Simba returned with the zebra he found Nala resting under the shadows of the trees and being sipping on some water that Timon and Pumbaa had been gathering in a big leaf. “They have been taking good care of her while I was gone.” Simba thought.

He walked up to Nala (still looking very starving) and tossed the dead zebra that he had been caring on his back in front of Nala. Just the sheer smell of meat and blood seemed to give Nala back a bit of her strength, giving that she managed to stand up and with staggering steps making it to the carcase. Just to take in smell again just to make sure it was real, and then she dived in and ate like crazy.

It had been such a long time since she had had a proper meal that she didn’t even thought about that the humongous lion that had been giving her the zebra actually was Simba. She was right now almost a skeleton of a lioness and just needed food to live.

Watching Nala eat made Simba both happy and sad. He was happy that he could be to such big help for his childhood friend how was almost at the verge of death when he found her. That was also the thing that made him both sad and furious. How someone could have been treating her so bad and then just leave her like this. He couldn’t wait for her to be finish with her meal so she could tell him what had happened to her.

With one last swallow Nala had completely eaten the zebra. All that was left was skeleton with barley anything one it. Nala’s stomach was now all round and sphere and full. She laid herself down on her back, resting her body of this enormous meal that she had now had. Even though she was feeling a bit of pain in her belly of all the food she had eaten, her face showed that she was feeling more warmth and alive now. Her eyes were also much more energetic now scanning her area that she currently was in now.

Looking around she saw trees and bushes and birds and rivers and frankly wondered “where were she now?” The last thing she remembered was that she was wandering in the desert running from the terror that was ruling the kingdom, and being so weak that she had collapsed and was about to become a feast for the vultures. The very last thing she saw before closing her eyes where this really weird creature that had come to save her. It looked at first glance like a lion, but it was so fat. Its legs all looked wider then her own waist, even back when she had a healthy looking body. And it had the biggest belly of every creature that she had ever seen. It looked like there was enough room inside there to have her whole inside it. The thing that hit her thinking about it was the creatures face. It looked so familiar, and it looked back at her giving her the same reaction.

Nala had just thought that when see turned her head to see a meerkat that was so fat that he didn’t seem to be able too move anywhere on his own. Next to him she saw an enormous warthog that was so looked so obese and juicy that it looked like something out of a food dream she ones had. The sight actually made her saliva drop from her mouth a little scaring the pig to step back a little.

Then she turned her head too look right at a big, round, yellow, furry, stomach. She knew immediately that this was the same creature that had saved her live out in the desert. She raised her head to see that standing tall was, just as she had guessed but not believing at first was indeed her old childhood friend and love.

“S-Simba?” she asked all confused and shocked. Simba couldn’t help but smile at just how over the top chocked Nala’s face where. She literary had her mouth just hanging down open because of this. “Hello Nala, how’s it going?” Simba replied quite normal just to tease a bit with Nala. “B-But how? H-How are you so so…” Nala asked almost speechless to Simba before getting stuck on the last word. “Fat?” Simba simply finished her sentence. Nala only gave a slightly nod, still keeping constant eye contact to him, not even doing as much as a blink. “Well…” Simba said while throwing his mane back still acting like everything was normal. “It all started with me tasting one little bug. It was a… Prionidae, I think. Was it that guys?” Simba asked Timon and Pumbaa. “Yes definitely.” Timon answered quickly. “I think so.” Pumbaa said. “I was unsure about eating it at first, but it had a great taste and was surprisingly satisfying.” Simba continued while waddling around the place giving Nala a great look at how his body was working while moving, seeing Nala taking in every single detail of it. “They became very addictive, and before I knew it I had been eating enough of them to give me a body like this.” Simba said and gave his belly a nice slap shaking it widely. “And that’s how I got so fat.” Simba said to Nala.

During all of this Nala had been able to take in the picture of that the lion male that she had had as play friend as a cub, had now become something that probably weight three times as much as a normal full grown male would weight. She had also bought Simba’s story of how he had become so big (Seeing that by doing nothing else but eating during all those years that Simba had been missing could be possible.). But one thing she still hasn’t been able to understand. Why? Why had he done this to himself?

“But can you tell me why did you become so… rounded?” Nala asked still not wanting to call him the obvious. “Well…” Simba tried to say something to answer, but he couldn’t. He had just as Nala had a hard time to take in the situation. While Nala’s problem had been that of Simba’s weight, his had been about the great guilt of being responsible for his fathers death. And he really didn’t want to let Nala know about it. He had also since talking to her started to feel something for her, and he could see that she felt the same and that she seemed really temped to “feel” his new body.

So with that in mind Simba continued where he left of… “Well, I would really like to tell you…” “Yes?” Nala answered curiously. “But wouldn’t be nice if I showed you some more of this place first?” Simba asked.

Nala thinking after for a moment finally said…
1411321112121.title: Nala Is Healthy Enough To Talk

1411322.content:
How about this?

After the uniting of the two prides, life settles back down for Simba and the pride as a whole. However, one evening he is troubled by an odd pain in his shoulder. Despite Nala's assurances that the ache will probably be gone by the morning, the King ventures to Rafiki's baobab to see if he can help him relieve the pain. But, once he climbs up, he finds the tree deserted. With his shoulder already starting to feel better, Simba decides that it would be best to head back, but he catches his paw on one of Rafiki's trinkets. Unable to stop himself, the lion falls over, with his open muzzle landing in a bowl of a strange, red goo. Quickly collecting himself, and washing the paste off in a nearby waterhole, Simba returns to Pride Rock with no further problems, unaware of what the mixture was intended for...
1411322.title: Other Options

choices: She Brings Back A Huge, Giant Feast
She Brings Back An Even Bigger Feast Since It's Easier To Hunt At Night
14113221.content:
Simba walked into the den, saying hi to Kiara and Kovu as they walked out, and he laid into his sleeping area next to Nala, licking her body lovingly.

"Did you get your shoulder checked by Rafiki?" asked Nala, returning the favor and rubbing her body against his, feeling his skinny body.

"Hmmm, well, he wasn't at his tree today and my shoulder stopped hurting as I came back. I think I'll go back tomorrow to see if he's there. Anyway, do you know when dinner is?"

"Yeah, I just sent out the pride to get something good," She smiled lovingly, "And I also had an urge to have them pick up something extra special for you, since you've always been sooo skinny all the time," she laughed as she began to play with him, rolling around, licking him, and, since no other lion or lioness was around, finally had the adult fun they both have been wanting for awhile....

Simba and Nala nuzzled each other with a new love they hadn't had in a long time, ever since they found each other in the jungle again.

"Hmmmm... that was great honey," Nala purred with a smile. Simba smiled, when his stomach growled loudly with hunger, which was unusual for him. He never seemed to get more than the least bit starving since there was always food around in the den.

"The pride must be getting a lot of food," Simba noted with pleasure. "I'm getting unusually very hungry!"

As if on que, the pride suddenly came back with more meat than they usually did. Zebras, gazelles, and even a hippo. Since all of the lions and lionesses simply adored their King and Queen for saving them from the wrath of Zulu, they willingly gave the extra food meant for Simba to him, bowing their heads in respect as they left to start their evening meal. Simba looked at his pride, who were waiting for him to begin eating, then back to his wife, who looked at him mischievously. Simba smiled and began digging into his food as if he was starving. The pride and his wife then began to eat their food with him, as Simba marveled at how amazing the food tasted today. It must have been that red goo I accidentally swallowed....maybe that's why I'm so hungry... Simba smiled. Whatever the reason, he really liked this new hunger of his, and apparently so did Nala....

By the time the pride had fallen asleep for the night, Simba was still chowing down on his food. His stomach had grown quite a few inches and he loved it, only wanting to grow bigger and bigger just for Nala's love. Once he started his fat hippo, he suddenly felt someone begin to rub his slightly bulging stomach. He looked down, slightly annoyed since it disturbed him eating and found out it was Nala, who laughed at him playfully.

"Nala!" he whispered in a loving tone. "I'm still eating and still really hungry, but there's not much food left. Do you think you could bring back kind of a lot of food?" Nala stopped laughing and looked concerned, even though she more than willing to get him more food at any time of day.

"Are you feeling OK? Was there something you ate at Rafiki's tree--"

Simba exhaled softly, still trying to eat. "Yes. I accidentally ate some red goo stuff, and I think that's what's making me so hungry all the time. And hey, I'll make up for it later tonight," He said this quickly but with a small smile on his face, showing Nala that he liked all of his hunger and that he was excited about their new, passionate love. She smiled, and quickly left after hearing this, determined to bring back something big again for Simba to satisfy his hunger.
14113221.title: An Order Fit For A Fat King (Part 1)

141132212.content: Nala soon returns with some other lionesses, each carrying a hippo. "Wow." Simba said as he started to dig in. With each bite, Simba's body swelled as the food turned into fat. He even started to develop extra chins and a large belly. He was in heaven, and there was still plenty of food left, this was going to be a long meal.
