Lucy had four incredibly large chins with fat cheeks on her face. Lucy's arms were as big as DVD players, Lucy was lucky that she could move her arms a little bit. Her stomach covered her whole body as it was out in every direction! Lucy still wore her while hat, white fur coat, and her white, heartless smile all thanks to the White Witch. As Lucy kept on eating, The White Witch's elf came into the throne room, which didn't even phase Lucy as she kept on eating her food.

"Fat White Witch, I know the White Witch would be so proud of you right now!" The Elf said. Lucy looked up at the Elf and smiled. In her dream, the White Witch had died and Lucy had won the war against Aslan and her siblings.

"Well, after she died, I promised her I would make her proud. How is Aslan and the children doing?" Lucy asked her assisant Elf now.

"They are going along very well, but you are still bigger. They can't take much more. You keep on eating and I will come back later to have you stone them or eat them! Whatever you want," The Elf said, watching the Fat White Witch tear into her food more. The Elf then slipped out of the throne room and walked down a big hall. He kept on walking until he opened another pair of doors and walked into a room as big as a football field. In this room was a huge pile of food with a ton of elves.

"Keep working!" The Fat White Witch's Elf said to all of the other Elves. They moved and scurried around, grabbing more food. They brought this food up to four, huge figures. It was Edmund, Susan, and Peter along with Aslan. All were incredibly fat! Edmund looked like a white sack of fat with a white hat on! He was so fat and rounded. Susan looked the same, but a different color with her jacket and no hat! She was smaller, but she had boobs. Peter, the eldest brother, was the fattest kid of the three! He had a brown coat while wearing a brown fur tassle hat. He had so many chins along with a huge, round rear. His rear made him sit straight up and unable to move. And last, but not least, Aslan was the biggest creature in the room, although not as big as Lucy. Aslan was big, round, and furry. His paws were billowing with fat rolls. His arms, neck, and hind legs were gone in his round, fat body.

What did Lucy do? After winning the war and capturing the four, Lucy brought them back by force and fed them fattening, addicting foods. The four were to the point now that all they wanted to do was eat, eat and eat! Lucy was so entertained by their torture that she couldn't decide if she wanted to morph them into food (so she could eat them and become incredibly huge!) or turn them into huge stones! All four of the huge figures couldn't help but continue to induldge. But as they kept on eating and eating, Lucy....
1543211111121111211211112112221211221221.title: Inside Of Lucy's Mind

1543211111121111211211112112221211221221.content:
Lucy suddenly opened her eyes and realized it was all a dream. But she saw that she was even fatter than before! She must have eaten a lot before she fell asleep. She saw a small rip that appeared in her dress. Quickly, she used some of her magic to make the dress bigger than it was.

"Too bad it was all a dream. But well, it doesn't have to stay a dream. Maybe I can become that fat! Why not? I can live centuries! The White Witch told me that. So, I'm sure I can become very fat! Just like in my dream!" Lucy said, grabbing her hat and pulling it down on her head.

She rolled out of bed, looking like a beached whale! She was definitely over 200 pounds in an morbidly obese state.

"Wow! I'm getting pretty big! I'm going to slowly need help for some stuff!"

Slowly, she waddled into the throne room. Even the short distance made her tired, sweaty, and exhausted. She was breathing loudly when she got into the throne room, approaching the White Witch.

"What's wrong with you my dear?" The White Witch asked, noticing the exhausted Fat White Witch.

"I'm just tired from walking over here. It's getting pretty hard to move!"

"You should have told me, dear. Then, I could have send some Elves to help you out," The White Witch said, motioning to a nearby elf.

"I'm hungry! I would like some food now!" Lucy said.

"Of course! You have such a healthy appetite. I like that," The White Witch said with a smile. "Maybe I should teach you a new trick," She said, poofing turkish delights for Lucy.

-----------------------------------------

"Here's my house. We'll be safe there for some time," The beaver said.

In front of them was a dam. Slowly, they walked behind him. To the left and right, you could see the river. It was hard walking on the dam since there was ice on the wood.

"I think my wife has counted on you children to come," He said while he opened the door.

Inside they saw an old beaver woman. She was preparing some food and stirred it in a pan. Peter and Susan both smelled the delicious food. The beaver wife looked friendly at them.

"So you are the son of Adam and daughter of Eve? You're gonna save our world!" She said.

"Wait a minute," Peter said. "Save your world? We? Are you sure you have the right people? We're not really heroes!"

"Sure! You will save our world. It's told long ago the White Witch took over our beautiful world. She made sure it was always winter but never Christmas. Anyone who tried to stand up to her, she..." He swallowed. "Well, she turned them into stone. For a long time, we couldn't do anything. But now Aslan is coming..."

"Who's Aslan?" Asked Peter.

"Don't you know? He's the king! He is the ruler of the entire forest. Now he hasn't been here for a long time, but we got a message he's coming. He will defeat The White Witch. After that, you'll rule Narnia."

"Still, I expected four extra guests. There's supposed to be four of you. Two sons, two daughters. So where are the other two?" The female beaver asked while she put some plates on the table.

"Well Edmund was taken by some small guys. And Lucy.... we don't know what happened to her," Susan said.

"So one of you has been captured and the other probably got captured too?" The beaver asked.

"I'm afraid there's no time for food. We need to take you to Aslan right away!" The female beaver said.

"So just so we understand... The White Witch is the ruler of Narnia and she's evil? Now Aslan is coming, the true ruler of Narnia, and he'll defeat The White Witch and after that, we will become king and queen?" Susan asked.

"In a nutshell, that's it," The beaver said while she packed a bag.

"But what about Lucy and Edmund? They are our family. How can we save them?"

"Don't worry. She won't hurt them... yet. The only one who can save them is Aslan. So let's go!"
1543211111121111211211112112221211221221.title: History Of Narnia

choices: Let The Fat White Witch See The Prisoner
Make The Fat White Witch Stay In The Throne Room
1543211111121111211211112112221211221221.content:
"That's right, Fat White Witch! Keep on eating the food!" The White Witch said to the greedy, little witch. She watched Lucy as Lucy kept on stuffing turkish delight after turkish delight into her mouth, down her throat, and into her fat belly. By now, Lucy was so huge! Lucy's butt was big and round while her belly was round and prominent. Lucy had a triple chin now with cheeks of a chipmunk. Lucy's thighs were as big as cinder blocks. Lucy's muffin top was so huge, it looked like a giant muffin! Lucy smiled as she pulled her hat down on her head and admired her body. Lucy's face was covered with food, making her look like a fat, sloppy pig. Lucy was getting to the point where it was getting harder to move. Soon enough, she would need more help to do the daily things in life. But she didn't care as long as she was the fattest thing ever like in her dreams!

"That tasted delicious! I want more!" Lucy said, grabbing the fat belly of hers.

"Good, my dear. But not now. Before we do anything else, I want to teach you more things involving magic and Narnia!" The White Witch said to her heir. Lucy started to frown, but then she started to think positively. She needed to learn more things about her future and how to rule. The more she learned, the more things she could do, the better of a ruler she could be, and the fatter she could be.

"Now, I want to teach you how to....."

Suddenly, the White Witch was cut off as the doors in front of the throne opened and the White Witch's elf assisant scurried into the room.

"My queen!" The Elf said to the White Witch.

"Yes? What is it now?"

"Well, we have a situation in the dungeon. The prisoner will not stop talking and keeps on resisting arrest. We need you to come up with a punishment for him, if that is what you want," The Elf told the White Witch.

"Very well. I will be there in a minute," the White Witch said as the elf exited the room.

"Can I come along? I want to see the prisoner. Maybe I can help with the punishment," The Fat White Witch said with a smirk. Although the White Witch was nervous about the idea, this could be a great learning experience for the Fat White Witch. The White Witch decided to....
1543211111121111211211112112221211221221.title: Even Bigger Than Before

1543211111121111211211112112221211221221.content:
"Well then..... All right! Let's go. Maybe you can help a bit. Let's see how you do," The White Witch said to Lucy.

Lucy happily stood up and followed The White Witch. However, the walk to the dungeon made her very tired. She was puffing and sweating when they finally got there. Lucy was really exhausted.

"Fat White Witch, what did I tell you? If walking is too much effort, you don't have to walk," The White Witch told her.

"Sorry, I forgot. Where's the prisoner?" Lucy asked.

Then, two elves came in front of Lucy and the White Witch, trying to hold Edmund who was still screaming, kicking and punching.

"That's enough!" The White Witch screamed. "Now stop it! Listen up, you little man. I believe you're a son of Adam. Am I right?"

"Well, yeah, I guess I am. But you have no right to capture me! I know my rights! I know the law! I..."

"Here in Narnia, I make the law! I can break any law just as easy. So any rights you know is totally useless here. But, maybe we can help each other," The White Witch said, smirking.

"I will never..." Edmund started.

Suddenly, he was cut of when he was splashed by some cold water. Lucy laughed in an evil and childish way.
Edmund looked angry at her. The cold water alone was bad enough, but it was so cold in Narnia, the water would probably freeze on his face.

"Ah, this is my heir The Fat White Witch. You can see why that's her name, right?"

Lucy looked at Edmund and just for a moment, deep inside her, something happened for a second like a spark lighting up darkness before going out. She didn't think about it anymore.

"She's still young. But believe me! What she can do is nothing compared to what I can do. So will you listen? You see, I heard you came here with two other kids. Is that right?"

"Well yeah. My brother and sister. But we were looking for my younger sister, Lucy. She might be here, too. But we're not sure about that," Edmund said to the White Witch.

"That's all I needed to know. Now that I have all the information I need, I could easily KILL YOU!"

"No please don't kill me!" Edmund screamed.

"Hmmm.... maybe I can still use you. What do you think, Fat White Witch? What should we do to him?"

Lucy looked at Edmund like if he was a delicious cake. She was thinking what would be best to do. She thought one moment about turning him into stone, but that was something The White Witch did and she wanted to do something she thought about on her own. Then, something came up in her mind. She remembered her dream. Maybe she could do the same thing like in her dream! Or could she come up with an even better idea?
1543211111121111211211112112221211221221.title: A Punishment For Edmund

choices: Follow Lucy And The White Witch
1543211111121111211211112112221211221221.content:
After thinking about it, Lucy decided that she wanted to do exactly what she did in her dream. She looked into Edmunds eyes, thinking of how hopeless the prisoner will be when she starts to punish him. She patted Edmund's hat on his head, treating him like a puppy. Lucy then turned around, looked at the White Witch, and whispered into her ear about the dream that she had earlier, letting the White Witch know what she wanted to do to Edmund.

"And because of that dream, I think we should fatten him to death! Or at least until we figure out what else to do with him," Lucy said, smiling an evil grin.

"My Lucy, that is a brilliant plan! Elves?" The White Witch screamed, making the elves scurry and approach the White Witch.

"I want you to put the prisoner in the dungeon and stuff him with food until we tell you otherwise!" The White Witch said, which made Edmund open his mouth in disbelief.

"You're going to fatten me up to death?" Edmund said shocked.

"Possibly. However I feel," Lucy said to Edmund, not knowing she was torturing her own brother. At that moment, the elves not holding Edmund brought in food to feed to Edmund. As Edmund saw this, the elves holding him put him in his dungeon, tied him to a chair in the cell, and began stuffing the food down his throat. After the first swallow, Edmund felt hooked to the food. It tasted delicious! Although he hated the idea of his fate, he wanted to eat more.

Through bites of food, Lucy could hear Edmund say things like, "You won't get away with this," and "This food is so delicious!" This made Lucy giggle, laughing at the torture the prisoner was going through.

"Speaking of food, I'm hungry!" Lucy told the White Witch.

"Let's go and get you some food," the White Witch said, motioning Lucy out of the dungeon. The two began to walk out of the dungeon. As they exited, Lucy looked back, seeing that the bundled up prisoner was already showing signs of weight gain.
1543211111121111211211112112221211221221.title: Stuffed In A Dungeon

1543211111121111211211112112221211221221.content:
In the meantime, Susan and Peter were walking through Narnia, following the beavers. Both didn't really know what to do, especially when both of them were thinking about becoming king and queen, which sounded sounded weird to them. Would that mean they would have to marry each other? Both weren't looking forward to that if that was the case.

"I still don't understand what's going on! So, The White Witch rules Narnia, but she isn't the real ruler? Aslan is? Now he's coming back and he will defeat The White Witch. But what does that have to do with us?"

"Well after the fight, Aslan will go again and then you need to rule Narnia, Big King Peter," The beaver said.

Peter must admit that he liked the title "Big King Peter."

"Together with Queen Susan, The Good One," The female beaver said.

Susan also liked her name and smiled friendly.

"But we still need your siblings. They will also be king and queen of Narnia together with both of you. Then Narnia will become a good land once again. We know you four will help us!"

"Well, how do you know we are the four children you keep talking about? I mean, there are millions of kids. Why the four of us?" Peter asked.

"It almost seems like you two don't want to become King and queen," The beaver said.

"No, that's not it. It's more... I'm not sure I'm the king you think I am. I don't want to give you hope and then suddenly it appears I'm not the king, but just a normal boy. Like I said, there are so many kids."

"True, but they're not in Narnia, are they? You four found your way to Narnia. We didn't have humans here for centuries. So it must be you! Aslan wouldn't come for no reason. He will tell you if you are or are not the king and queen. If you're not, I don't blame you two."

"But If we are... then what do we need to do?" Susan asked.

"Lead our army to victory and rule Narnia to a good land like in once must have been," the female beaver said.

"Well, I guess I could try to help you. But we must save our brother and sister!" Susan said.

"And we will when we find Aslan."

"So Aslan is a lion? I hope he can eh... talk. Just like eh.... like you," Susan asked carefully.

"Of course he can talk! Who else would have given all animals their ability to talk?"

"Ah, is this a daughter of Eve and a son of Adam?" A soft voice suddenly said.

Susan and Peter saw a fox. The fox looked kind of friendly but Peter and Susan suspected the fox might see the beavers like food. But the fox seemed to have no intention to attack the beavers.

"So, you are a son of Adam and a daughter of Eve? I already saw your sister. Where's the fourth one?"

"Wait, you saw our sister? Lucy? Kind of small? Thin, red hair? You saw her?" Peter asked.

"Hm, I saw a girl. But she wasn't really small or thin. She was fat. Very fat and she seemed to like it. She had red curly hair and she seemed to be a bit around your age, maybe a bit younger," He said and pointed at Susan.

"That can't be our sister! That looks nothing like Lucy," Peter said.

"I'm afraid she's your sister. There hasn't been other people in Narnia for ages. It must be her. But she said she was the heir of The White Witch," The fox said.

"What? We need to get to Aslan now," The beaver said.

"Follow me! I know the fastest way," The fox said and ran away, followed by the beavers Peter and Susan.
1543211111121111211211112112221211221221.title: The Big King Peter And Queen Susan, The Good One

choices: See How Fat Edmund Has Become
1543211111121111211211112112221211221221.content:
Meanwhile, back in the White Witch's castle, the Fat White Witch, Lucy, was stuffing herself with even more turkish delights on the throne. She was tearing through box after box as the White Witch poofed more and more when Lucy ran out. The White Witch was still smirking from the punishment Lucy gave her brother. Lucy was truely becoming evil, showing that she would be a good heir. Lucy was even happy with the fact that she got to choose someone's fate, giving her control. As Lucy's clothes felt tighter, she pointed to herself and made her clothes even larger. This time, Lucy's hat grew a little to fit her fatter head. At this point, Lucy would become immobile soon enough.

"Fat White Witch, I am very proud of what you have done today," The White Witch told her heir.

"I am proud of what I have done. I love the feeling of having power over people," Lucy said, playing with herself.

"So how long do you want to stuff him?" The White Witch asked Lucy.

"Well, I am not sure yet. Maybe until he bursts! Or maybe I could eat him!" Lucy told her master. The White Witch began to laugh.

"Very thoughtful, but you can decide that later, dear," The White Witch told her, smirking.

"I will let you know when I decide. In the meantime, I think I need to think about how I will get around. I think I will need the elve's help now," Lucy said, playing with her hat as she finished her box of turkish delights.

"That's fine, my dear. Speaking of moving, do you want to learn more magic right now or see your prisoner?" The White Witch asked. Lucy began to think to herself. Should she advance herself with magic or see how much fatter her prisoner has become?
1543211111121111211211112112221211221221.title: Bigger Fat White Witch And Edmund

choices: "I Want To Torture Him For A Little Bit By Feeding Him!"
"I Want His Amount Of Food Increased!"
1543211111121111211211112112221211221221.content:
"I want to see how much fatter my prisoner has gotten!" Lucy said immediately.

"As you wish. Let's go!" The White Witch said.

"Elves! Carry me!" Lucy commanded, making the White Witch smile.

"Great commanding, Fat White Witch! You are truly learning!" The White Witch said as they headed to the dungeon.

The whole ride was torture for the elves because of Lucy's sheer mass. She was very hard to carry. As soon as they got down the dungeon, all elves feel to the floor, which made Lucy's fat body crush the elves, which in a way, was like a cushion to Lucy.

"Help me up!" Lucy commanded.

Quickly, the elves did their best to get up. They helped Lucy rise, even though it took a few minutes of struggling.

"Well, what do you think of your prisoner?" The White Witch asked.

Lucy began to observe her prisoner. It had been a few hours since the feeding began. Already, Edmund had put on at least ten pounds as his stomach looked a tad bit bigger. It looked like Edmund was gaining some fat on his face, but not a ton. The changes weren't too heavily noticeable, but time would change that.

"Not too bad. Could be better," Lucy said to the White Witch.

"True. But we can increase the flow of food," The White Witch said.

Quietly, Lucy observed Edmund, her fattening prisoner. She noticed how Edmund seemed to look similar to her. He was even wearing the same type of clothing, which made Lucy smile.

"What are you thinking, Fat White Witch?" The White Witch asked.

Lucy went up to the prisoner, who was way too focused on his food, and began to pet his hat like a owner pets a dog. Lucy grinned.
1543211111121111211211112112221211221221.title: Checking Up On Lucy's Prisoner

choices: Back To Lucy And Prisoner Edmund
1543211111121111211211112112221211221221.content:
As they were running along, they were all putting their hands up, blocking their faces from the branches. The fox kept on running, leading the way. After about ten minutes of solid running, they all stopped to take a breathing break from being exhausted. By this time, they were out of the forest, panting like crazy.

"Well, that was exhausting!" Susan said, hands on her knees and panting.

"It could have been worse. Where are we now?" Peter said as he adjusted his hat and fur coat.

"We are out of the forest finally. We have some ways to go though," the fox said.

"Look! You can see Aslan's castle from here!" The beaver said as they turned around. They all saw a frozen ocean with an island far out. On the island was a castle as big as it was in fairy tales. They were all amazed.

"Isn't that beautiful?" The beaver said.

"It sure is," said a voice from behind the group. They all turned around to find a man taller than Peter wearing a fur coat with a long, white beard, white hair, and big boots.

"Good day, sir. How are you?" the female beaver asked the man.

"Very well, thank you. I noticed you all were on an adventure. I wanted to give you all gifts," the man said, heading for a sledge located behind him. He went into it, reached into a bag and came out with gifts.

"Mr. and Mrs. Beaver, I give you guys these bow and arrows to fight anyone in your way," the man said, handing the beavers two small bows with arrows. He then reached into the bag and grabbed more gifts. "For you, fox, I have this," the man said, handing the fox a bottle of a liquid. "This is a liquid that energizes you and gives you strength on your journey," the man said as the fox thanked him. The man finally looked at the two kids.

"Here are your gifts. For you, Susan and Peter," the man said. They were surprised that he knew their names, but they grabbed the gifts he handed out. Susan looked and saw that she had an liquid bottle like the fox, but on it, it said Wound Repair. Peter also opened up his gift and took it out of the box. It was a sword! He was surprised as he drew it out and looked at it. They both looked up to thank the man, but before they said anything, he and his sledge were gone.

"Who was that man? Santa Claus?" Peter said.
1543211111121111211211112112221211221221.title: Meeting A High Figure

1543211111121111211211112112221211221221.content:
Lucy was busy stuffing her face, adding more fat to her body, but her mind was still wandering off. Since she saw that boy, something didn't seem right. It felt like she had seen him once, but couldn't remember when. Everytime she thought she remembered it, it slipped away.

"Why can't I stop thinking about him? Did I really meet him before?"

She tried to remember but couldn't find any memories. She thought nothing of it.

"Maybe I should just eat him! Hmmm. Could I do that?"

Before, Lucy never thought about cannibalism. But back then, she was a sweet girl and most of that was totally gone in pounds of fat. She was a hungry and growing girl and needed good food, AKA a meal fit for a queen.

"But I better wait before I eat him. I think he'll taste better when he's fat. Maybe he can be used to get those other two kids! I wonder who they are," Lucy wondered.

Lucy stretched her fat legs a bit. She became very lazy. Just sitting on her throne added to her lazyness, but she liked it. The White Witch also liked her lazy, seeing her hardly moving a muscle. The White Witch had just what she wanted: An evil girl.

"All right dear. I think that was enough food for now. I think it's time for another lesson."

The White Witch wanted to teach Lucy more magic faster than she originally planned. First was because Lucy did it very well. The second reason was since she knew Aslan was probably here. Even while she planned to rule Narnia a few centuries more, she knew there always was a small chance that Aslan would kill her. She realized that Aslan was a dangerous opponent. If she was killed, Lucy would need to take over and she wasn't ready for that. Sure, she was evil and all, but ruling Narnia.... she wasn't ready for that. She also knew Lucy realized that.

"Maybe it's time to pay Aslan a visit, to show him I have that boy and use him like bait to catch those other two. I could also enjoy showing him who my heir is!" She mumbled softly to herself.

"So what are you going to teach me?" Lucy asked greedy.

"Oh, you're still waiting until I teach you how to make turkish delight. Don't worry. It won't take long before I will teach you it."

Lucy grinned widely and looked with big eyes at The White Witch.

"Here I have an apple. But I'd rather have an orange. You understand what I want you to do?"

"Turn the apple into an orange."

"Right. This is more difficult since you have to make something totally new from something else. Try to make it an orange. Do your best to think of an orange," The White Witch said.

Lucy closed her eyes and concentrated. Slowly the apple turned orange and and soon looked like an orange.

"Good." The White Witch said. "But..."

She sliced with her hand past the orange peal and cut it in half. The inside didn't look like an orange, but like an apple.

"Don't only concentrate on the outside. Also the inside and the taste!"

Suddenly, Lucy smiled. She closed her eyes strongly and concentrated. The apple with the outside of an orange started to move and changed from shape and color and the next moment, she held up a piece of turkish delight.
Lucy grinned. The White Witch also needed to smile when she saw what Lucy had done.

"Wanna try it to see if it has worked?" She asked.

Lucy opened her mouth widely and The White Witch tossed it in her mouth where it soon disappeared.

"It tasted good!" Lucy mumbled. "But I'm very tired now. I think I will go to my room."

She heaved herself up from her throne. It took a lot of effort. Then, she remembered something.

"Elves! Come over here! I need help to get to my room!"

A few elves got in and helped her on her feet. One carried her belly and the others helped her with walking to her room. As soon as Lucy fell on her bed, she was out like a light.
1543211111121111211211112112221211221221.title: Outside And Inside

choices: See What Lucy Is Up To Now
Susan And Peter See It's The Wolves
1543211111121111211211112112221211221221.content:
"Well, we should be there soon!" Susan said, pushing her older brother along.

"I hope so! I am becoming exhausted with all of this walking!" Peter said, puffing from the long walk. As of now, the group was a mile away from the castle on the frozen lake. The whole group was wondering what Aslan would be like, especially Peter and Susan who had never seen Aslan before. They all knew that if they made it to the castle, they would all be safe for now.

"Once you meet Aslan, you will be able to see why he is such an influence to our people," The beaver said. He looked at his beaver wife, smiling, as they were moving along.

"Well hopefully we can save our siblings too while we are at it," Peter said, hoping that his two siblings were ok. He couldn't bare to think if his sister looked like how the fox told him. Bigger and fatter? He couldn't picture it.

"We could save them in time, but we will have to see with Aslan himself," The fox said.

"Wait! Stop! Do you guys hear that?" Susan said as everyone stopped in their tracks.

From behind, they could hear the sound of snow crunching as something was moving closer to them. They turned around, noticing nothing was behind them. As they waited, the crunching got louder and louder until finally, from a mile away, they could see some kind of group coming out of the woods they entered before.

"Let's hurry before we find out what that is," the female beaver said as the group began to run along.
1543211111121111211211112112221211221221.title: Walking On Rocky Waters

choices: We Have More Important Things To Do Right Now
1543211111121111211211112112221211221221.content:
They started to run, looking over their shoulder now and then. Whatever was coming behind them was coming fast. Peter couldn't really see what it was yet. It was gray and very big, but as it came closer, it became clear it wasn't big. It were several creatures with the same gray fur that were bunched up together, making it look like one, huge animal.

"What are those? Dogs?" Susan asked.

"No! It's worse! Wolves!" Peter yelled.

Susan needed to think a moment about old fairy tales like little red riding hood. Sure, that was a fairy tale and she didn't believe in fairy tales since she was younger, but now, she was walking in a winter land she entered through a wardrobe. On top of that, she and her sister and brothers would need to rule this place and fight against a witch. After all that happened, why wouldn't the wolves eat them?

"We've almost reached the castle. In there, we're safe," The fox said, who was running faster than the others.

All of them tried to run a bit faster, but the wolves came closer. They were very fast! They could clearly hear the wolves barking and growling. The long nails of the wolves made nasty clicking sounds on the bridge and crunches in the snow. But all of a sudden, it was like everything suddenly froze and every sound stopped. Peter and Susan looked around, wondering what happened. The wolves stopped and looked with their jaws wide open. Their tongues were hanging out of their mouths without moving.

The doors of the castle opened slowly. Some white light peeled through the opening and then, they saw a figure in the light walking on four legs. The figure stepped forward. The fox and beavers went aside to make room for him.
It was a lion! A big lion! His fur looked like gold as he seemed strong with his eyes that made him look wise. He seemed to glow with some power that no one could explain. Slowly, he stepped forward to Susan and Peter.

"So you two are Peter and Susan?" The lion asked the kids. His voice sounded wise in two different ways: one way was like from an old person who saw many things, but it wasn't a old voice when looking at it from the other way. It was a strong and powerful voice you need to obey. He looked at the wolves, opened his jaws, and let out a loud roar. Aslan looked at them and said...

Lucy opened up her eyes. She felt very well rested. She rolled out of her bed and smiled when she saw how fat she was in her mirror. She slipped her hat tightly on her head as she observed her fattened body.

"Soon, I will be immobile! Then, the elves will have to carry me when I want to go somewhere. Still, that prisoner is getting fattened. I can't forget about him. I think I need to see him again. Elves!" Lucy yelled out loud.

Soon enough, some elves came in and bowed before Lucy's huge belly.

"I want you to help me walk to the dungeon," Lucy commanded to the elves. Two elves took her by the sides and one carried her belly. Lucy smiled at this. This made walking much more easier for the evil little witch. Besides, why did she need to move? She was the future ruler fom all of Narnia. Everyone need to obey her! Even that Aslan guy needed to obey her, who ever he was.

In the dungeon, Lucy saw Edmund and smiled. He was way fatter than before! He was sitting at the moment. He spread his legs out earlier so his belly could rest between them. His belly almost came to his knees! His thighs were as thick as tires and on top of that, he had big moobs. His arms were flabby and his under arms were slowly disappearing in his upper arms. He had two extra chins and his neck wasn't more than a ring of fat around it. He wore a white tassel hat like Lucy, but his hat tassels were not tied since his chins were too thick for him to tie the tassels with. His cheeks were so puffed out, it looked like he stuffed a jawbreaker in each of his cheeks. He was downright fat now.

After seeing Edmund, Lucy started to worry a little bit. Suppose he became fatter than her? Then she wouldn't be the fattest!

"STOP!" She said with loud voice that echoed throughout the dungeon. Everyone stopped feeding Edmund immediately. Of course, The White Witch was the ruler, but they knew they also needed to obey The Fat White Witch except when The White Witch didn't agree with Lucy.

"Thank you!" Edmund mumbled through his fat cheeks.

"Don't thank me yet, human. I just don't want you to get fatter then me, but I want you to get fat! And even after that, maybe you can still be of any use. If you can't, well, we'll see then. At least, until I'm sure what to do with you, I need to make sure you fit in my mouth," Lucy said with a greedy grin.

"You're... gonna... eat me?" Edmund said through his fat cheeks.

"Maybe I will, maybe I won't! Didn't you listen to me? Maybe we can use you! If we can't, or at least after we used you... what will we do to you then? I don't know for sure. But maybe I'm gonna eat you at that time. But, if I do that, I need you to be able to fit in my mouth for now! After I know what we will do with you, well, I don't know yet... or maybe you will end up in here!" Lucy said as she pointed to her belly and chuckled evilly.

Edmund hardly couldn't believe how evil she was. She was just telling him that she was going to use him and maybe just eat him after that without showing the smallest piece of regret!

"Elves! Bring me to the throne room! I said now!" Lucy screamed to the elves. Edmund looked at how the elves struggled to get the fat girl out of the dungeon. He wondered why they helped the girl and why she was so unfriendly to them. Didn't they had a choice to obey? He himself felt miserable after what happened. He never really cared about his weight before, but this wasn't how he wanted to be, especially if he were to die this way. What would they do to him? How would they use him? And after that, would Edmund end up being eaten... or... what else would happen to him? Maybe something even worse would happen to him. What could be worse than being eaten alive by a fat girl? He could't think of anything worse. After thinking about that, Edmund breathed heavily as the elves locked the dungeon door behind them.

Lucy waddled into the throne room. The White Witch smile when seeing the elves helping her walk.

"Ah, my dear Fat White Witch! How are you, dear?"

Just then, the wolves ran inside the throne room, looking afraid as they stared at The White Witch shivering.

"We had them... and suddenly, Aslan came and... saved them," the wolf said as he was panting to The White Witch.

The White Witch looked at them as if fire was spitting out of her eyes. It seemed like her face was burning with rage. Her voice got so loud, you could hear it throughout the whole castle.

The wolves ran out of the throne room before The White Witch would have done something to them. The White Witch was sitting on her throne. tapping with her hands, making ticking sounds with her nails.

Edmund looked at Lucy. He squinted his eyes and then he opened his eyes wide again.

"LUCY! Is that you?"

"No! Of course not. I'm The Fat White Witch. I'm the heir of The White Witch!" Lucy said stubbornly. Lucy looked at Edmund, but something had happened to her. Lucy? That name sounded familiar to her. She felt a feeling like the name was a nickname you had when you were a toddler and didn't hear it for about twenty years and then suddenly hear it again. Lucy? There was something about that name, but she didn't know what.

"It was dark in there and you wore different clothes at home then now! I can't see your face under that hat hardly. Also, I was trying to escape!"

The White Witch enjoyed seeing how scared Edmund got, but she knew there was a chance Lucy would really eat him and she still needed him for now. So, The White Witch made a huge box of charmed turkish delight for Lucy. Lucy quickly started to stuff her face with it.

The next moment, the sledge started moving. Edmund looked at what his sister was eating.

"NO! IT'S MINE, MINE, MINE!!! YOU CAN'T HAVE ANY. IT'S MINE! MY TURKISH DELIGHT! I'M A HUNGRY, GROWING GIRL! I NEED FOOD!"

"That's right. Keep you hands off the turkish delight I made for my heir," The White Witch said with a grin as she patted her heiress on the hat.

"Just some advise kid," The elf said. "I would do what she tells you to do!"

"And be treated by her like you?"

"Well, it's better than becoming a rock in her garden or that fat girl's next dinner!"

"Does she really eat people?" Edmund asked.

"We don't have much people here. But she hasn't eaten anyone yet. But be careful! That doesn't go to say she won't do it!"

"Stop talking to the prisoner!" The White Witch screamed.

Lucy looked angry at Edmund. She pointed at him and then pointed into her mouth and slowly moved her finger past her throat and stopped at her huge belly and grinned evilly at him. Edmund gulped. Even while doing all that, still, she kept thinking about the name Lucy. There was something about that name. The Turkish delights helped her clear her mind.

"Ah! We're here," The White Witch said.

Shivering, Edmund climbed out of the sledge. He hoped that there was a small chance that Aslan could maybe do something to help him. He hoped that Aslan could maybe even save him. He sure hoped that he could. Still, he couldn't believe it that that fat girl used to be his sister. Lucy had always been nice and kind to everyone and Edmund, even when he didn't deserved it sometimes. But this girl was very evil. She seemed to enjoy pain and misery of others. She seemed to only care about food and eating. Edmund felt that she was way too fat already. That was nothing like his old sister who had always been thin like a rail. She was way fatter, maybe, and a bit older looking, but she could also look like that because she was so fat. Was this really his little sister? If she was, there was nothing left of his old sister. "Ah, Aslan. Good! You're home," The White Witch said.

Edmund opened his eyes wide. He stopped believing in fairy tales a long time ago, but half of the creatures he saw now were things from stories and poems. The other half were animals. In the middle, he saw Aslan, a huge Lion with big eyes. He saw his big jaws and thought for a moment that Aslan could devour him just as good as Lucy could. But then, he saw Peter and Susan standing next to him and his heart made a small leap of hope.

"So, White Witch? You've finally decided to come," Aslan said with his loud voice.

"Well, I do have a heir now," She said with a smile.

"Silence!" The White Witch yelled. "I do have a heir. Sure she's not my child, but I raised her like my own daughter. Aslan, may I introduce you to my heir... The Fat White Witch!"

"I'M NOT LUCY! THAT'S NOT MY NAME! HOW MANY TIMES DO I HAVE TO TELL YOU? I'M NOT LUCY! I'M THE FAT WHITE WITCH! IS IS IT SO HARD TO MISS THIS HUGE BELLY?"

"She does have a point there," Someone in the crowd said.

Aslan roared one time and the creature that had spoken kept his mouth shut.

"So, that's your heir. Who is that other person you have?"

"Who... Oh, that. I don't really pay attention to his name," The White Witch said.

"Peter, Susan! It's me! Edmund! Please help me!"

"Edmund, what happened to you? You're so..."

"Fat! That's not my fault. The witches stuffed me with food. I couldn't do anything about it," Edmund yelled.

"His name isn't important. I think I call him... lunch," Lucy said as she giggled in a mean way.

"Please help me, Peter and Susan!"

Lucy looked up at the two other children. Deep down inside her, she got the feeling she knew those names and those faces, but she couldn't remember where.

Aslan walked forward.

"May I ask... what is risk?"

"It's... it's a board game," Peter said.

"Something like chess?"

"Yes, something like that. You also play some kind of war. But it's not real. It's with friends. Just for fun," Peter said.

"Wars are never fun, King Peter the Great One. Especially not when the other people once were friends of ours," The centaur said.

"I'm just not sure I can do this. I'm just a boy. Now I suddenly need to lead a war," Peter said.

"We have faith in you, King Peter. Our lives belongs to you," The centaur said.

"That does make me feel better. Thank you," Peter said.

The next moment, an eagle flew over.

"The White Witch is coming! The White Witch is coming!" He yelled.

Peter grabbed his sword and looked down the hill. All evil creatures of Narnia gathered in the army of the White Witch. Dwarves with axes, wolves, spirits of evil trees and poisonous plants, nightmares, sea snakes , monsters, and Peter even saw a few giants. Many were creatures he used to be afraid of when he was a child until he believed they didn't exist. But now they did, which was a strange thought.

Peter suddenly thought about his poor brother, Edmund, and his sister, Lucy, who were taken by The White Witch. The rage spread through his body. He became angry, but Peter knew what to do. He took a deep breath and stayed calm. Pure anger wouldn't help him, but only blind him. He had to stay calm but use that anger. He knew he had to win or else his siblings were doomed. Not only them, but he and all creatures here who believed in him, too. He couldn't let that happen. Suddenly, he felt confident. They trusted him. He wouldn't let them down. He raised his sword.

"ATTACK!" He yelled.

All creatures attacked. You could see moving fur, skin, scales with loud screams and the sound of metal on metal.

---

"Shouldn't I be helping Peter in the war?" Susan asked while she saw what happened from an area away from the battle.

"You want to save your sister and brother, right? Peter Is the one who can lead the war. But if I need to save Lucy, it's better if she sees someone she trusts," Aslan said calmly.

"But it seems like she doesn't even know me. You remember what she said when we saw her?"

"I do. But If she becomes normal again, she'll see me, a huge lion. It could scare her. Besides, maybe you can help her return her memory. I need to go there anyway. We need to get a part of my army back," He said with a grin.

"Which part?" Susan asked in a confused tone.

"The part that The White Witch turned into stone. I need to save them, your brother and sister. Come! Climb on my back," Aslan told Susan.

Susan did as she was told and held tight to his hair. Aslan started running. He was so fast that Susan's eyes quickly started tearing, but she loved the feeling at the same time. She hardly could see anything.

"If this is all over, I need to come back here to see it all," She thought to herself.

Finally, they came closer to the castle of The White Witch.

"I?" Lucy asked surprised.

"Didn't The White Witch teach you any magic?"

"Well she did..." Lucy said as she made a box of Turkish delight appear and start to eat it. "I can still do it," Lucy said as she ate the Turkish delight.

"If we bring back Edmund, you will lose your magic. You will be a normal girl again who wouldn't be able to let a feather float. Do you accept?"

Lucy sighed. She really liked her powersm but she liked her brother much more. Maybe losing her powers was better.

"Of course I accept. Do it," Lucy said.

Aslan breathed in her face and let out a mighty roar! A yellow light appeared around her and Lucy felt like something was pulled out of her. The yellow light turned into a spiral. It slowly became less and when it was gone, there was Edmund bundled up in his fur coat and hat just like he had always been before he was captured.

"What... what happened?"

Lucy and Susan both rushed forward to hug him.

"What happened? How did I get here and... Lucy, is that you. How did you get so fat?"

"Don't you remember anything?" Susan asked surprised.

"Well I remember we played hide and seek. We walked into a closet and were suddenly in a strange winter land and looked there for Lucy. And now, the next moment, I'm here. Did I miss anything?"

Susan looked at Aslan.

"Maybe it's good that he doesn't remember. Did you have anything to do with that?" Susan asked as she was whispering to Aslan.

"Well, it seems like we found Lucy. So we can go home now, right?" Edmund asked.

"No, we're in a war. I'll tell you what you need to know. Aslan... de-stone or whatever it's called to bring your army back. We have a war to win," Susan said.

"We're in a war? I thought our plan was to be away from the war," Edmund said.

"In another world it was. But in this world with war... It's not. Try to feel brave Edmund. We need to fight," Susan said.

"There's one problem. Could you help me walk outside? It's hard to move with this fat body. Ho do I get there?" Lucy asked.

"I think we need some giant power!" Susan said with a grin as she was remembering the stone giant outside.
1543211111121111211211112112221211221221.title: Lucy Back To Normal

choices: Susan Likes The New Look, Which Makes Lucy Happy
Susan Hates The New Look, Which Starts Fighting Between The Two
1543211111121111211211112112221211221221.content:
About a half an hour after Lucy was back to normal, they were ready to leave the castle. This time, there were more people coming out than there were coming in. Immediately, Aslan had de-stoned all of the people that The White Witch had turned into stone. By the time Aslan was done de-stoning, there were over a hundred more people to add to the army fighting The White Witch. Aslan told them all what was going on as all of the creatures agreed to help fight against The White Witch.

The army was a sight to see. There were many different types of creatures that were leaving to fight for war. There were giants taller than pine trees walking along to the battle. Centaurs gallopped away with determination filled in their hearts. Many different types of mystical birds flew over head as they were getting a view of the snow-covered land that was their home. In this mix of people was Aslan, who was leading the pack as Edmund held onto him on his back. Behind him was a giant that was carrying Susan and Lucy, her now fat sister who remembered everything. As they were traveling back, the sisters were talking to each other as they were both happy with their reunion.

"Wow, Lucy. You really do look different. You know that, right?" Susan said as she studied her sister.

"I know. I mean, a lot of me is different besides the extra weight," Lucy said as she grinned down at her body.

"Definitely. I mean, your hair is longer and more curly. Your eye color seems a little bit lighter, but not that different to me. You're wearing different clothing, too. The white dress that fits on your body looks very pretty on you. And surprisingly, the hat on your head just tops off everything along with the extra weight. I mean, you're even bigger than me now by many pounds. It's all so different," Susan said to her sister as she continued to study Lucy's new look.

"I know exactly what you mean. The White Witch changed some things on me. I mean, when I came here, I was obviously very skinny. But also, I was wearing a brown fur coat along with my plaid dress and a brown tassel hat. My hair was also very straight, but short too. I do look different. Although The White Witch was pure evil, I do think that this look does make me very pretty. I likes the new appearance, the new clothes like the hat, and even the weight on my body. I think it makes me look more cute. What do you think?" Lucy asked her sister, hoping that she would feel the same.

Susan studied her sister more and came up with what she felt.
1543211111121111211211112112221211221221.title: Aslan's Army And Feeling Pretty

choices: The Death Of The White Witch
1543211111121111211211112112221211221221.content:
"Sure! I looks kind of cute in a way," Susan told her sister.

"What do you mean by in a way?" Lucy asked suspiciously.

"That means that your fat can be seen in different ways. I guess some people can call it cute," Susan said. On the other hand, she did remember that when she saw babies, she always liked to cuddle and play with them. Normally those babies also had chubby limbs that looked adorable. Looking at it from that way made her fat and her new look kind of cute. Of course, Lucy was way past the point of chubby. But still.... thought Susan to herself.

"And how will other people call it?" Lucy asked.

Susan didn't know what to say. She knew very well that a lot of girls at her old school tried to stay slim and thought fat people were disgusting. But she wasn't planning to tell that to Lucy. She didn't want to make Lucy cry.

"Some other people will not like it as much. It's just like food. Some people like sausages a lot. Others just like it a bit and some hate sausages. Some will like it and some will not. Don't worry too much about it, Lucy. Not yet," Susan told her sister.

"I'm glad you think I'm pretty," Lucy said with a fat grin. Susan looked at her sister and thought that her sister looked pretty. Not that she fell in love with her sister at that look. She was hetero, but she thought her sister looked pretty. All the fat, clothes, and new hair did look very good on her sister. Susan did not want to be fat herself though.

"Eh... But Susan, you mentioned something about a war?" Lucy asked.

"Oh! I thought I already told you. Aslan created this world. Narnia is his creation. The White Witch took over and made it always winter in Narnia. There was a prediction that four kids would come together with Aslan and then The White Witch will be defeated and the four of us will become king and queen of Narnia. Now we are going over to the war. Peter is there all alone," Susan said in a worried tone.

Aslan looked down at the battlefield. Then he looked at his new army and opened his mighty jaws and said: "All right you all... ATTACK!"

Aslan's loud scream made all the others stop fighting for a moment. Then Aslan's "RAWR!" sounded over the battlefield. Screams of joy could be heard. Creatures started to gain hope now that Aslan arrived and many were happy to see old friends or relatives back alive.

"All right, Lucy. I need to help them," Susan said. "Hey Pegasus! I need a lift!"

A flying horse flew over to Susan. Like an amazon, Susan jumped from the giant right on the back of the flying horse and the next moment, she took an arrow, put it on her bow and joined the others in the war.

In the meantime, Peter was busy fighting a minotaur. But also, he had seen Aslan with Edmund and the giant who carried two people that he assumed were his sisters. It was a bit difficult to see from this distance. Besides, he was very busy now not getting killed. But a centaur saw the trouble and the next moment, the minotaur was killed with an arrow. Peter looked thankful at him and saw for a moment how his oldest sister also joined the war. She was calm and every arrow she fired hit a target. There were also a lot of statues around. The White Witch had been busy. But suddenly, Peter jumped in front of her.

"So! We meet again," The White Witch said. "Do you really think you can beat me?"

She put her wand away and suddenly she had a stone knife.

"It's much too risky to turn you into stone. Aslan could turn you back. So I'm more wise to just kill you right now. After that, I only need to kill that other big sister of yours and then I..."

"It seems my sisters and brother just arrived!"

The White Witch looked at him and then looked over her shoulder. She saw the giant with what was supposed to be her fat heir. Also, there was Aslan with the boy on his back that was supposed to be in the belly of her heir. And then, she saw Susan in the air shooting arrows.

Aslan had defeated her. He took away her heir and brought that boy back to life. But at least she could take Peter with her. She tried to stab him, but Peter stopped her attack with his sword. Both started fighting so fast that the knife and sword soon were both a blur while the new part of the army started to help Peter's army. The giant put Lucy down somewhere away from the battle and ran to the others to help. Lucy had a good view of the battlefield and wished she could help.
1543211111121111211211112112221211221221.title: To The War

1543211111121111211211112112221211221221.content:
Peter and The White Witch continued to fight like they were a pack of wolves. They were so busy fighting, they didn't realize some of the snow was melting. There was still a lot of snow, but there was less than before. After each swing of their swords, loud clinking sounds were heard across the battlefield. They continued to fight each other as both of them saw no end in sight. After one swing, Peter fell on his butt and hit the ground. His sword flew out of his hands and moved a couple feet away from him. The White Witch grinned at this. Suddenly, her stone sword turned into a crystal knife. She stood above Peter as the pointed end was facing his face, making him realize that this could be the end of him and Narnia.

"You took away my heir, my victims, and my power. This is my land! Not yours, not Aslan's land, but mine! But I will take it back now! Goodbye, Son of Adam," The White Witch said as she began to move her crystal knife.

Peter could only think that this was the end. But luckily for him, it wasn't.

Suddenly, a shattering sound stunned The White Witch and Peter. Peter looked up and found the source. Right behind The White Witch stood a tall, brave lion named Aslan with Edmund holding onto his back side. With his paw, he clawed the crystal knife and broke it into a million pieces. The White Witch's cruel smirk turned into a pale frown of fear and sorrow. She knew now that this was the end of her solemn hour.

As she looked into the eyes of Aslan, she started to feel herself fall apart on the inside as if she were evaporating. With one final look, Aslan swayed his paw with his claws, swung at The White Witch and made her fall to the ground. The White Witch continued to remain motionless on the ground as everyone stopped and looked on. They began to notice that The White Witch was starting to dissapear as parts of her body began to fade away. It was almost as if she was melting, but instead, slowly dissapearing. Within a minute, all that remained was the crown of The White Witch. Before Peter could grab it, it vanished. The White Witch was finally dead. Narnia was free.

Cheers of victory started to echo across the battlefield as The White Witch's army started to retreat with Aslan's army chasing them away. Peter grabbed his sword and held it tight, realizing that he was the leader that lead this world to victory.

"Thank you, Aslan. You saved my life," Peter said to the lion.

"Thank you, Peter. You saved my world along with your siblings," Aslan told Peter as Edmund smiled to his brother and as Susan and Pegasus hit the ground. The three siblings immediately hugged each other with happiness. Then Peter remembered something.

"What about Lucy?" Peter asked Susan.

"Safe and sound. She's up on the hill. I think we should go to her now!" Susan told her brother. With that, they hopped on Aslan's back and headed up to Lucy.

Meanwhile, watching the whol war from beyond was Lucy. Since she was very fat now, she was sitting on the ground watching the battle the whole time. She was shocked to see all of this happen. She was partly sad that The White Witch was dead since she was friendly to her. But Lucy knew that The White Witch was a manipulator and that she had to die. Lucy started to wonder if parts of The White Witch would be inside of her. She had no clue, but then again, she really didn't have any signs of that at the moment, which made her not worry. All she could think about was her siblings as they headed for her way.

"Lucy!" Peter yelled at her sister. He noticed that she looked different and fat, but he could care less at the moment as they embraced with a huge hug. Edmund and Susan joined in as all four were finally reunited.

"I'm so glad you're alright," Peter said to Lucy.

"I am too! I mean, I look different, but I am glad that I have you guys back," Lucy said with a grin. Aslan smiled as he watched the siblings embrace.

"Well, all four of you have saved my land. You are meant to be the real rulers of Narnia," Aslan said with pride. All four kids looked in shock and surprise when hearing this. They felt many emotions. Susan looked at her sister and noticed a weird look on her face.

"What is it, Lu?" Susan asked.

Lucy then started to talk to her siblings.

"I.....
1543211111121111211211112112221211221221.title: The Death Of The White Witch

choices: Fast Forward To A Week Later
1543211111121111211211112112221211221221.content:
"I'm not feeling right. I mean, I was very mean. I did some terrible things," Lucy said in a discouraged voice.

"Lucy, that wasn't really you. It was the power of The White Witch that did make you evil. Besides, you haven't done that many terrible things. If we would have saved you later, you might have been right," Susan told her sister.

"You guys are terrific. But do the other creatures of Narnia want me to be their queen?"

"I'm sure they will," Aslan said.

Lucy saw a whole row of wounded creatures that were waiting by the fox with his bottle of liquid so that he could cure them. She looked at the battlefield. Aslan turned every statue back to life immediately. Everyone seemed happy The White Witch was finally dead.

So we're now kings and queens of Narnia?" Susan asked.

"That's right," Aslan said.

Suddenly, Lucy saw a small animal run towards them. She suddenly saw it was a squirrel because of his big fluffy tail. He smiled friendly.

"We want to invite the four kings and queens for a delicious dinner tonight to celebrate our victory of The White Witch," said the Squirrel.

"Wait a minute. Did you say all four of us? So I'm also invited? I can also come?" Lucy said with a grin.

"Of course. You're queen, Lucy the good one. We all want to treat you and your sisters and brothers like the kings and queens you all are. You are all the real rulers of Narnia!"

"Yeah," The beaver said. "A lot is destroyed thanks to The White Witch. But it's starting to get better. The snow is already melting. But it will take some time before everything will be all right here. But with you four are rulers, I'm sure everything will turn out fine!"

"Well we will do our best," Susan said.

"They want me, too," Lucy said slowly. "Aslan, am I cured now from any spell from The White Witch? I mean, there's nothing left of her in me, is there?"

"Don't worry, Lucy. You're totally free from The White Witch," Aslan said.

"Let's go to the others. Most must be cured by now!"

"Susan, Peter, Edmund? Can you help me walk? It's a bit hard for me to move now," Lucy said as she patted her fat body.

Later, they were all sitting on the grass field enjoying a good meal and enjoying dances from dwarves with the sound of flutes played by saters. There were a lot of campfires everywhere. Almost everyone wanted to thank Peter because he lead the war and that it would be a honor to fight with him again. Peter was happy with that. Not that he liked fighting so much, but he knew as king, you sometimes need to fight like they did today.

"Are you feeling all right Lucy?" Susan asked.

"I am now. No one seems to mind how evil I was," Lucy said.

"That's good. Now we need to rule Narnia. Besides, Lucy, are you going to lose that weight?"

"No, I don't think so. You know I like it. It's warm, it feels cozy, and it feels nice and soft," Lucy said with an even fatter grin.

"It's your body. Want some Turkish delight?" She asked.

Lucy's face turned a bit green and looked the other way.

"I don't think I want to eat anymore Turkish delight for as long as I live," Lucy mumbled.
1543211111121111211211112112221211221221.title: The Battle Ended

choices: Check How Much I Weigh Now"
Explore Ways Of How I Can Become Fatter"
1543211111121111211211112112221211221221.content:
Lucy opened her eyes. She was staring straight up at her ceiling and noticed that the ceiling she was looking at was very different than the one she saw before in The White Witch's castle. Her ceiling had tints of red and gold that wrapped around the room. Her bed was even bigger than it was in The White Witch's castle.

Lucy rubbed her eyes and began to move her fat legs to the side of her bed, which made her swing her body. She could feel her body jiggle as she moved. By now, she was definitely very fat. After a night of celebration and excitement, Lucy went to bed without wearing any of her clothing. She remembered this as she looked down at her fat body. She was lost in the amount of flab that spreaded across her body. Like she told Susan, she wanted to keep the pounds on her body and maybe even gain some more weight. Lucy felt even more excited. Now she was one of the Queens of Narnia. She could probably spend her days eating and ruling and becoming even fatter. She was looking forward to her future.

Immediately, a few animal servants came in to help out Lucy since it was hard for her to walk and let alone change herself. Two of the animals helped her stand up while the other animals grabbed her clothing and started to help her. Two birds grabbed her large sized white dress and slipped it on over her head. After she got it on herself, the birds went behind her and tied up the back strings for the dress. In the meantime, another bird flew up and placed Lucy's hat gently on her head, which made Lucy smile. A fox was at her feet as it helped Lucy put on her shoes and tied her laces. The birds even helped Lucy put her coat on her, making her look like the same old Lucy she had looked like for the last little while. They had changed her a lot better than The White Witch's servants had. Lucy's body wasn't even this big and the animals changed her into her clothing more peacefully. Lucy smiled at the servants.

"Thank you very much, you guys. I really do appreciate it," Lucy said with her fat, pudgy smile. The servants bowed their heads back to her and helped her start to walk. Lucy was so happy with this new place.

"I'm living in paradise now. Everything is peaceful and happy. I am so happy that everything has worked out for me," Lucy thought to herself as she giggled to herself. She started to think of what she wanted to do next. She was becoming more curious about her weight. She had no idea how much she weighed. She knew that she had gained a lot, but she didn't know the exact number. Also, she wanted to find ways to add on extra pounds. She thought quickly as her servants helped her walk.

"If you all don't mind, I would like to....
1543211111121111211211112112221211221221.title: Waking Up In Paradise

1543211111121111211211112112221211221221.content:
"Check how much I weigh. Do we have a scale?"

"Well we do have one," The fox said. "But that's just for measuring ingredients for cooking."

"That won't do. Doesn't any one of you have a scale? Or do you never check your weight?" Lucy asked.

"Sure we do. We have some scales at hom, but even if we would take them here, I'm afraid it won't help you since... I think you're way heavier than the maximum weight," said the fox, which made Lucy smile.

"Well..... but I would like to know my real weight," Lucy said sadly.

"Well we of course could make a bigger scale that can hold a bigger amount of weight. That should be possible," A bird said and looked at the other animals in the room.

"Of course, the dwarves are very handy to make anything made of metal. I will ask them right away. I'm sure they will do it for the fattest Queen of Narnia." The fox said. "Dwarves like it if their woman are a bit chubby. I don't know why really," the fox said.

The fox ran away to give the news to the dwarves while a few other animals helped Lucy walk over to the throne room. Lucy suddenly noticed how warm it was here. She remembered how cold it always had been in the castle of The White Witch. She never really noticed that back then.
There were four thrones in the room. One for all four of them, but they were all empty.

"Hey, where are my brothers and my sister?" Lucy asked.

"In the dining room eating breakfast and waiting for you," A faun said.

Lucy licked her lips. Sure, she wasn't evil anymore and was a nice girl again and wanted to help any creature in Narnia, but she was hungry now and still loved some good food. As long as it wasn't Turkish delights. She had eaten so much of it and remembered how it changed her that she could hardly look at and think about it.

She came into the dinning room and saw her siblings and also a few of the animals that helped them most like the beavers and some other magical creatures. But out of all of them, she noticed one was missing.

"Hey, where's Aslan?" Lucy asked.

"Oh, he just left. If you're fast, you can see him leaving," Peter said.

Lucy quickly waddled to the nearest window and saw him leaving.

"You need to let him go," The beaver said. "He has other things to do. But I'm sure he will return once again. He comes and goes whenever he wants to. He isn't a tame lion," The beaver told Lucy.

Lucy sighed. She was a bit sad Aslan left, but knew that what the beaver said was true. Suddenly, she noticed she was starving and turned to the table but noticed her belly was in the way of reaching for the table. Some of the others laughed softly and some came to help Lucy and feed her.

"Well, this is our first days of being King and Queens of Narnia. We will try to rule your country as well as possible. But we will need a lot of help to know everything about Narnia," Peter said.

"Well, we will all be glad to help you four," The beaver said.

"Lucy, take it easy," Susan said suddenly. "You don't have to eat so fast. It's not like anyone is going to take it away from you and there's more then enough," Susan said to her sister.

"Well, I'm just very hungry. I might not be evil anymore, but that doesn't mean that I will stop gaining or that I'm not hungry," Lucy said through a mouth full of food.

"Well, we knew how to stay alive with the food we could get while we were in an endless winter. Now we can grow vegetables, grain and so on. I think we'll have enough food, even for the great hunger of Princess Lucy, the fat one," A faun said, which made Lucy really grin.

"I'm sure some of the tree spirits would like it to help let vegetables and grains grow," A leopard said.

"So, you're planning to keep the weight and gain even more?" Peter asked Lucy.

"Yeah. What's wrong with that?" Lucy asked.

Peter took one look at Susan and then at Edmund.

"You're right. What's wrong with becoming fatter? But just be careful that you don't gain too fast," Peter said.

"Where are the centaurs and Pegasus, by the way?" Susan asked.

"Oh, I invited them inside, but they liked to stay in the forest, or in Pegasus's case, in the air," Peter said with a laugh.

Lucy smiled widely well she was fed more food.
1543211111121111211211112112221211221221.title: The First Breakfast At Cair Paravel

choices: Lucy Enters Her Room To Get Weighed
When Lucy Gets On The Scale
1543211111121111211211112112221211221221.content:
"Princess Lucy, the fat one? Your scale awaits," the fox said as he ran into the room.

"Well let's go see it. But do you mind helping me? It's hard for me to walk," Lucy said as she pointed to her fat frame. Immediately, the animals complied and helped Lucy out of her seat.

"Lucy, we will be here if you need us. Just don't rush into things too quickly, okay?" Peter said to Lucy.

"Okay. I won't. I will see you all later," Lucy said as the animals helped her out of the room. Right after the doors shut, the three other siblings looked at each other.

"Is she really going to become fatter?" Peter said to Susan.

"Well, she talked to me about how much she wanted to gain and how she liked it. Besides, I do think it does look cute on her," Susan said.

"I like it, too. There's so many girls that try to be skinny today. I like seeing some bigger ones," Edmund said in compliance.

"Well, I don't know if I am on board with it, but as long as we have her, then all is well," Peter said as his siblings agreed. They then continued to get back into business.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Meanwhile, Lucy was with the animals waddling down the hall as she was heading to her room to use her scale. She was very excited to see how much she weighed at this point. Just not too long ago, Lucy was probably one of the skinniest girls you would see. But now, Lucy had become so much wider and fatter. All she was was fat with no muscle. But Lucy didn't care. She loved her fat and she loved gaining weight.

As she was thinking about this, Lucy kept on looking at the items down the hall. There were many portraits of different parts of Narnia and pictures of Aslan. Lucy smiled at this since she was very thankful for being saved by Aslan. She kept on looking until she saw a door that was so big, it was triple Lucy's height.

"What's in that room?" Lucy asked the fox.

"That is the room of undisclosed desires. Only few have and can go into the room. You and the others are allowed to go in, but it is a very powerful room. Whatever you want, you will get from the room only if you deserve it," The fox said back to Lucy. Lucy looked mysteriously at the room as they walked on and finally came up to Lucy's room.

"After I get weighed, I need to go in there," Lucy said with a grin.
1543211111121111211211112112221211221221.title: Wandering Down The Hall

1543211111121111211211112112221211221221.content:
Lucy entered her room and saw a huge scale. She wondered if the dwarves made this or already had one. She decided to ask.

"Eh... did they already have this scale?"

"Yeah, they did. They normally used it to weigh gold, silver and valuable rocks. So I guess it can tell how much you weigh," the fox said to Lucy.

Lucy thought back one moment about the room. She wondered if it really was true. Could the room do anything you wanted? Only if you deserved it, the fox told her. She wondered if she deserved anything after what she had done. But that wasn't her own doing. It was because of The White Witch.

She before never saw herself as mean. She was a nice girlie girl and mostly thought about others before herself. Sure, she had been bad sometimes, but who hasn't? Most of the time she had been nice.

"Are you ready, Queen Lucy?" Someone asked her.

"Eh, yeah of course," Lucy said.

"You know, Queen Lucy, if you do gain much more weight... well I'm not sure we will be able to help you walk. You have a chance of becoming immobile. If you want to, we're fine with it, but you need to know this before you do it," someone else said.

This did make Lucy think. She'd love being fat and gaining weight since it was great, but not being mobile anymore was a problem. At the castle of The White Witch she could float and let things appear so she never really worried about it. But now... she really needed to think about this.

"Well let's first see how much I weigh. After that we'll see," She said.

Carefully she placed her feet on the scale. The fox looked at how fat she was. All animals in the room were quiet, curious about her weight.

"It's around 675 lbs," The fox said.

"Well that's very impressive for a girl your age," A squirrel said.

"Yeah, I don't believe there has ever been a heavier girl. At least not at this age," another animal said.

Lucy smiled since she liked hearing she was the fattest girl ever.

"Thank you all. That does make me feel good. Now you can go. I'll call you if I need help," Lucy said with a grin.

The animals left and Lucy started to think.

Sure she loved being fat and gaining weight, but never being able to walk again would be hard. She wanted to see Narnia in his pure glory. Outside, the snow was almost gone. On the other hand, the giant could always carry her. He was really nice, but not too bright.
Then she thought about the room. She could wish for more weight. That would be fun, but on the other hand, that would make her lose the fun she had with eating. Or she could wish for staying mobile. Would that be possible? Did she deserve it was also a question.

Lucy thought about an hour and then decided...
1543211111121111211211112112221211221221.title: And The Weight Is...

choices: "You Deserve For Your Desires To Come True!"
"You Don't Deserve Your Desires Coming True!"
1543211111121111211211112112221211221221.content:
After a while, Lucy decided that she wanted to go into the room of undisclosed desires. She wanted to see if she was worthy of being able to be in the room. After deciding this, she called for the animals that helped her walk before. Immediately, they came in.

"Could you all help me walk to the room down the hall? I want to check it out," Lucy told them with a grin.

"Are you sure? I mean, no one knows what people are worthy of it," the fox mentioned to Lucy.

"I am sure. It's worth a try to see," Lucy replied to the fox.

Immediately, the fox shook her head in acceptance to the idea and the other animals started helping her walk out of her room. Lucy was feeling excited, but a little scared since she really didn't know what to expect out of this. She just hoped everything would work out well. After a few minutes, the animals stopped helping her move as Lucy discovered they had helped her to the door.

"Thank you. I can get it from here now," Lucy said to the animals. The animals started to go away except for the fox.

"Are you sure about this?" the fox asked her one last time.

"Yes, I am. I need to see this," Lucy said to the fox. The fox complied and let her be. Immediately, Lucy slowly moved her fat leg forward as she tried to push the door open. As the door started to open, a bright light started to show, enticing Lucy and her fat body forward. Within a minute, Lucy entered the room and shut the door behind her.

As the door shut, the room got very dark, which came across as creepy to Lucy. She had no idea what was going to happen next.

"Lucy," said a voice. She looked around and saw no one as the room got a little lighter. All it was was four brick walls surrounding her. She wondered where the voice was coming from.

"Sit down, you plump beauty," the voice said to her. Lucy turned around and saw a chair magically appear before her eyes. It surprised her.

"Where are you coming from?" Lucy asked the voice as she sat down in the chair.

"I am the voice of desire. I give the ones who deserve their wants the most glorious things they could desire. Only if they deserve it," the voice said to her.

"Do I deserve my desires from you?" Lucy asked the voice quietly. After that, there was a silence. The next thing she heard was....

"Yes. You deserve your desires to come true!"

Lucy smiled and her eyes started to sparkle. She could wish for everything she wanted now. Back in the real world she wished so many times for a new toy or some nice clothes. But she wasn't going to use this chance on something like that. Besides, this was better than just getting some stuff. This would be pure magic. You could go way further with that even if you would have $1,000,000.
Another thought came into Lucy's head. Sure, she was now the Queen of Narnia. At least one of the two queens and one of the four rulers of Narnia. She would like to use this to get something for herself, but on the other hand, she should probably use this to help the other creatures in Narnia. But even if she did wanted to do that, would it work? Sure, her head would say yes, but her heart would say something else. Would this voice follow what you said or what you really desired?
But this was the room of undisclosed desires. Desires... that meant more than one. But did this mean that you could have all your desires come true or only one desire for each person?
Lucy remembered a story about a guy who was offered something and signed a contract. Later it seemed he signed a contract with the devil. He signed to sell his soul. He was saved by his sons, but Lucy wondered if her desire would come true or did she have to sacrifice something? Edmund told her once: "You don't get anything for nothing. Everything has its' price!"

Lucy must admit that Edmund wasn't totally wrong about that. In the real world, people normally always wanted something in return. On the other hand, this was Narnia and not the real world.
All those questions kept going through Lucy's head.

"Are you all right, fat beauty?" The voice asked.

"What?... Eh yeah I'm fine. I was just thinking about some things," Lucy said.

She looked around the room again. There was still four brick walls with not one piece of furniture except for the chair she was sitting in.

"Eh I was wondering.... is there a catch? I mean, if I told my desire and you gave it to me... do I have to sacrifice something?"

"No, you don't. No one needs to sacrifice something. Also some people would use these powers for evil. It was made to only be used by people who are worthy like you. If you're worthy, you don't have to give anything," the voice said.

Lucy became a bit nervous. She wanted to know if you could get more than one desire granted, but she didn't want to act all greedy. She had been so once before with The White Witch and it disgusted her that she once had been that way.

"So what is your desire, fat beauty?"

Lucy's brain worked as fast as it could. She and her siblings would rule Narnia as best as they could. If they only had to desire that, everything would become right that was a bit wrong. Like being too lazy to fight for something. She stood right up.

"My desire is..."

Lucy started to think of more possible desires. She wanted to gain weight, of course, but then she thought of something: She always wanted a boyfriend, or in this case, a spouse. She was happy that she was with her siblings, but she also wanted someone that could be a lover to her or a friend. This was definitely a desire for her.

Then again, she also wanted food. She wouldn't mind wishing for a huge pile of food. Both things were tempting to her. She could wish for both of these right now, but then again, she didn't want to be selfish.

"First, I desire...."
